Reviews.Title: “Great find in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: sidperson
Reviews.Content: Just returned to the US after a 5-day stay at Seen Hills Hotel in Istanbul. We really enjoyed staying there. The location is perfect -- just steps away from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. It's about a 15 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and about 20 minutes to the Spice Market. It's also about 5 minutes from a stop on the tram, which is useful for seeing other parts of the city. Our room was very nice, with a drop-dead view of the Hagia Sophia. (We were on the 4th floor, which should have the best views.) The bed was large and comfortable. The bathroom was nicely outfitted. One complaint, though: the jacuzzi tub/shower had tall sides that made it difficult (or even dangerous) getting in and out of the shower. I would not recommend room 402 to the aged or infirm for this reason. It's too bad, since the room is otherwise very nice. The restaurant and the roof-top deck have spectacular views -- supposedly the best in Sultanahmet. There is a buffet breakfast each morning in the restaurant. In good weather, you can sit outside. The views inside and out are great. The breakfast is nice (but not world class) -- fruit, dried fruit, yoghurt, cheese, cold cuts, cereal, American coffee, tea, etc. They will also offer you eggs each morning. What makes the hotel special, though, is the staff. Every one of them, in both the hotel and restaurant, goes out of his or her way to make you feel welcome and to take care of your needs. At every turn, the staff tried to make our stay in and out of the hotel as enjoyable as possible. They were happy to make all the arrangements we needed (tours, restaurant reservations, etc.) and to recommend places to see and eat. This was our first visit to Turkey and we loved it. We will definitely return some day and when we do we will return to Seven Hills Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CJPSanRamon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Seven Hills hotel in Istanbul just this past February, a mere 2 months ago. The way we were treated was excellent and I donâ€™t mean from when we walked in the door but from when I made contact with the hotel. Timeliness, accuracy, and above all hospitality. Sechkin, Ozan and the entire staff are great folks with sound recommendations of where to go, what to do, everything, Istanbul is their town youâ€™ll do well to ask them questions and to listen to them. The foyer was smaller and old world quaint. Our room was what was promised and more. I didnâ€™t know that the Blue Mosque and Hadja Sofia could almost be touched from my balcony. We spent a great 5 nights there with only one night where we had above average noise from restaurant traffic and a partier. The Seven Hills restaurant is second to none and we tried plenty, we should have eaten there more. And now the view... from both the restaurant and the upstairs roof. Incredible! The 4 Seasons wishes it had a 360 view like this. They say in real estate that the three most important attributes to a property are Location, Location and Locationâ€¦ You will believe this when you climb up to the roof restaurant Even if you donâ€™t stay here (and you wonâ€™t know what you are missing if you donâ€™t) come and eat and take some pics, you will not regret it.... Oh yeah, as we continued on our trip to Africa from Capadoccia... we stayed there again... canâ€™t wait for next time.

Reviews.Title: “Seven hills restaurant Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Wistar B
Reviews.Content: The Seven Hills Restaurant has excellent views, good food and friendly efficient staff. Highest rooftop terrace between Aya Sofia and Blue mosque with views of both as well as panorama of the city and the sea. A real treasure.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location,amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ramazan D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days enjoyed every minute of it. From the moment of arrival, till departure, my stay here was perfect. An excellent hotel in a super location.Hotel is just two minutes walking distance to Hagia Sophia,,Blue Mosque TopkapÄ± palaceThe room was very clean and comfortable. There was fresh water in the room each day for us We tried the fish restaurant at the Hotel which we highly recomend,the food and the service was excellent and it has the best view. The hotel staff is very professional, speak English and are so friendly and warm amazing with a boutique Turkish feel.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly & exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: F e
Reviews.Content: All of the Hotel staff were very friendly and made us feel at home. We were very happy during our entire stay. The view from the top restaurant was breathtaking. The Aya Sofia on one side, the Blue Mosque on the other and the Bosphourous right in front. Waking up every morning and enjoying Istanbul from the Seven Hills hotel was really nice. Make sure you try their fresh Fish grilled. The hotel staff will put on a show with your fish grilled and will light up a fire over a rock salt. You will know what I mean when you order a whole fish grilled :)

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MandyJaneK71
Reviews.Content: I am quite a fussy traveller but I really enjoyed this hotel. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way for us - even sourcing rice pudding from another restaurant one night as they had run out in order to accommodate us. We were also offered an upgrade on our final night. The rooms are spacious and the food is delicious. The location is excellent as well - within walking distance of the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia as well as the Grand Bazaar. I will definitely stay here again. What a wonderful place - I didnt want to leave...

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel, service, location & staff!”
Reviews.Author: WynM
Reviews.Content: I chose Seven Hills for our stay in Istanbul based upon reading reviews on Trip Advisor and the hotel's location. My expectations were exceeded in every single way!! It is a 2 minute walk to the Blue Mosque; a 3 minute walk to Hagia Sophia, in the centre of the Old Town of Istanbul and the Grand Bazaar is a 15 minutes away by foot - location does not get better than this! Location is only one aspect of why I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff are simply amazing!! Reception, bell-boys, restaurant staff at breakfast and dinner go well beyond the call of duty to make you feel welcome and to make your stay as wonderful as humanly possible. Ozan at reception deserves special recognition - as would everyone else if I wrote down their names. Rooms are spacious and very comfortable, and despite other reviews, we found the evenings and nights quiet and peaceful. Breakfast was terrific with the best view in the entire city up on the roof. And the restaurant makes any trip to Istanbul complete with stunning views over the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Bosphorus at dusk. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a suite on our final night, a room complete with a dual-aspect balcony. I am so impressed and wouldn't consider staying anywhere else when I return to Istanbul - which can't be soon enough!! Thank you Seven Hills!

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Mel_Johnny
Reviews.Content: Smell in the bathroom is not that nice but ok. Everything else is very good Restaurant is ok but not the best fish in town. It is possible to eat same fish for half of the price just few blocks away!

Reviews.Title: “Go for location...but not for peaceful nights”
Reviews.Author: ChiGirl78
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Seven Hills hotel while planning our wedding in Istanbul. The location is really the main reason to stay here. The Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque are literally in the backyard, and lots of great bars/restaurants are nearby. The hotel features a great rooftop for views of the city, but the restaurant is so-so. The breakfast was horrible....they kept bringing the same food (literally, the exact food) from each day before (it was majorly off-season, to be fair), and you could tell from the cheese discoloration and the gradual decay of the strawberries. Highly gross and insulting, as the price of the room is definitely higher than what it should be. The rooms were ok, and the heating was good. However, because the hotel is famous for its views, tons of tour groups come to the hotel for dinner upstairs late into the night. And with the elevator being tiny, most tour members stomp down the stairs noisily after dinner. With floors being marble and wood, don't count on getting sleep till well after 12:30. BUT...the staff at the hotel are very sweet and helpful. The location is very good for sightseeing, and you don't have to go far for beer and kebap. So...if you bring ear plugs, you should be pretty ok:)

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Tafart
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago and what I saw was devastating. It was clean, staff was dedicated n careful. Thank you Seven Hills Ä°stanbul!

Reviews.Title: “great small hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: igor174Moscow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Seven Hills Hotel several times over the years. In fact, when in Istanbul, I always stay there. It is a great hotel in the the city's greatest neighborhood. The location is extraordinary with balconies facing the Sea and the Aya Sofia. The staff is most helpful. The restaurant is terrific, and the pricing is reasonable. But the greatest thing of all is its terrace with one of the best views in the world. That alone makes the stay wortwhile. When in Istanbul, I highly recommend the Seven Hills Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mary A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I here for 4 nights in November. From start to finish, this is a high-quality hotel. The location was excellent, within walking distance to all major sites Hagia Sophia,Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, as well as restaurants and shops. We also received an upgrade, and had a beautiful room with a balcony and view of the Hagia Sophia and Marmara sea. The staff always had a smile on their faces and went out of their way to help answer questions. They really do a good job taking care of their guests and making everyone feel special. If you are looking for a hotel with helpful staff, fluent in English, in a convenient location, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to say in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Lauren C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Seven Hills Hotel several times and it is the best place to stay in Istanbul. The service is fantastic, the rooms are clean and beautifully decorated, there is a rooftop terrace with an amazing view, and the location is perfect. Seven Hills is a short walk from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Cistern, Topkapi Palace, the Grand Bazaar and more. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Charming place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: yulia t
Reviews.Content: We have just recall from this charming place. First of all I should point hotelâ€™s excellent location in a heart of old city in a walking distance of main sightseeings. The interesting interior is made in so called Bosthorus style. The trpl room is spacious and has all facilities. Good cleaning. We were very much impressed of restaurant at the roof of the building. In mornings we had breakfast buffet there and in evenings it works as a fishing restaurant with great menu, wine list (uncommon for Turkey), hospitable servants. The hotel staff should be mentioned particularly. The special attention deserves Mr.Osan â€“ the receptionist. Very helpful, English speaking and competent guy. He always ready to answer all your questions and solve the problems that may arise. We had a very late departure and he was very pleasant to prolong our room after a check-out time. I could advice the Seven Hills as a nice place for a good price. Next time in Ist. gonna stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: olgavira
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Hills in October. Everything is right about this place : the location is perfect, in Sultanakhmet, walking distance from everything. Their roof is above all roofs. Your view is not blocked by anything, you are above everything! The fish restaurant on the roof is fantastic. Wonderful breakfast in the morning, fantastic fish for dinner. I had the best baklava there. All baklava is great in Istanbul. Their was THE best. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and nice. We were lucky to stay at presidential suite but I'm sure all rooms are nice. Next time I would not stay anywhere else. We did stay at Ritz Carlton in Istanbul as well. Seven Hills is not the Ritz, But I'd stay at the Seven Hills: location is so much better; proximity to attractions; and, of course, the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service and Great Room”
Reviews.Author: Byron1975
Reviews.Content: This is simple a great hotel choice. When looking at a map of the area you don't understand that this hotel is probable the best hotel one could get. It sits with a direct view of the Saint Sophia and Blue Mosque. Many of the rooms have this view, but all guests can enjoy the views from the 4th floor panoramic restaurant. Although the Saint Sophia and the Blue Mosque are just around the corner I choose to book a 1/2 day english guided tour through the hotel with an outside company for 35EUR (Imperial Tour). The tour group was very small and the guide was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Hills Superb and ideally suited for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Pedro258
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel with superb service for my family. We visited in half term Feb 2012 and initially I was a bit scared at whether the hotel reviews I had read had been genuine in the light of the trip advisor hype. Fortunately right from check in we were greeted by a fantastic staff, excellent English speaking staff and very eager and informative. Our room was the Presidential suite and was adequate in excess to our families needs. The bathroom had hot running water and the room service was excellent. The breakfast was in the charge and comprised of a buffet with an assortment of breads, salads, cereals etc. It was good for a days start and the view from the restaurant and roof top was also superb. This hotel is in a quiet location in SultanAhmet and is lietrally just walking distance from the Hagia and Blue Mosque I am most certain that should I go back to Istanbul it will be the Seven Hills once again . Thank you very much The front desk gentlemen were superb !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: NR2012
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is found in the older part of Istanbul..quiet street, little traffic. We can't adequately express our thanks to the staff of the Seven Hills Hotel for their exceptional service. Having arrived late after a long flight, we were treated to Chai tea in the foyer while a room upgrade was arranged and made ready. Great view of the Hagia Sophia from our window and balcony and wonderful views of Istanbul and the Marmara from the dining room upstairs and a 360 degree vista from the rooftop. Restaurant at night offers fresh seafood, brought to your table to choose your fare ,taken to the kitchen ,prepared & served. Hot shower! A treat after a day wandering through Istanbul. The mosques, spice markets and palace all within easy walking distance. Turkey was an unknown for us but our experience here has given us a longing to return.

Reviews.Title: “I will return again!”
Reviews.Author: jennifertrina
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Seven Hills for my second time just recently. My first experience there this past summer was amazing, and when I had to make a last minute trip to Istanbul in January, it was my first choice. I felt like I was returning to a familiar place, as the staff are so friendly, and remembered me from my previous trip. The location is absolutely perfect in the old city, within walking distance to great shops, restaurants, and cafes. It is situated right between the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sofia (with beautiful views of these from the 3rd floor rooms!), so very quick easy to walk to these amazing places, also the Hippodrome, Arasta Bazaar and the Grand Bazaar. My favorite spot in Istanbul was actually on the rooftop restaurant of this hotel! With it's amazing 360 degree views of the mosques, and the water, having breakfast up here is the perfect way to start the day. Be sure to go again at sunset... what a fantastic place to be, when the sun sets and the mosques light up. Feels like a fairy tale. By far the best place to dine in all of the old city, with fresh seafood and the most amazing views. I will be back one day, and look forward to being there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent dining experience”
Reviews.Author: bredaryanlong
Reviews.Content: This was one of the nicest meals I have had in Istanbul, and I have eaten in many restaurants there. From the moment I arrived at this hotel everything was top class. I was greeted by a young man called Ramazan at the door and he could not have been more helpful and polite.He went out of his way to assist me He is a great front door person because I immediately felt welcome.. I am a vegetarian and I asked the waiters to ask the chef to prepare something special for me. I had the most wonderful salad starter the ingrediants were so fresh it was unbelievable, and the vegetable casserole was mouth watering. The desert was divine and the homemade bread hot out of the over was beyond tempting. Every one of the dining staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful and I really felt at home.the chef even came out at the end to see if my meal was ok. I could not recommend this restaurant and I dined there a few times during my stay.I almost forgot the view which was breathtaking... Top marks for this wonderful hotel and its staff.. well done and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: goodtravel 2
Reviews.Content: This hotel (boutique) is across the street from the Four Seasons Hotel. It's a good location and we stayed in one of the executive suites (floor 3) which had a wonderful view of the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. We loved having breakfast at their roof top restaurant. The price was right too.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Hills hotel pleases again”
Reviews.Author: rcman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 10 years ago and loved it. Stayed again in November 2011 and were not disappointed. The hotel location is surperb. The view from the rooftop restauant is arguably the best in Istanbul. Since it was in November this time the rooftop wasn't open for eating, but the view is still worth a look. Dinner up there on warmer days is killer good. Our room was good size, comfortable and clean. Service was very good and the hotel is well maintained. Highly recommended. When we return to Istanbul we'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: eiad b
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills Hotel modern and old a good standard The location was just perfect Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmet Mosgue , Ibrahim Pasha Museum, everything was less than 10 minutes walk It is in the centre of the city which is really useful if you want to take a short break during the sight-seeing Also we liked that it is in a small, calm street so we werenÂ´t disturbed by the noise We were staying there in December so big plus for us was the kettle in the room, I could make a Tea and Nescafe anytime These were in the price of the room We could also regulate the heat in our room so we didnt have to worry about the cold But the main thing why I recommend Seven Hills hotel to anybody is the friendly staff I have never meet so nice and helpful people specially guy called Ozhan anywhere His were recommending us which places are worth of seeing, work well . We would highly recommend Seven Hills if visiting Sultanahmet again .

Reviews.Title: “Very nice small hotel in a magnificent scenery!”
Reviews.Author: Piteou
Reviews.Content: We liked Seven Hills very much. A top small hotel at a top location! Friendly staff and good value for money. We enjoyed the rooftop restaurant and it's magnicifent views. We dream to come back. Joop Doornbos & Sylvia Dusault

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great service”
Reviews.Author: N D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in November of 2011. The location can not be beat and the view from the hotel's roof top restaurant is fabulous with the Blue Mosque on one side and Aya Sophia on the other. I only ate breakfast at the restaurant but it was very substantial and the service was very good. The beds are a little hard but that is standard fare in Europe too so no real complaint there. The room was very clean and the hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I definitely recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to see the Old City.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience!”
Reviews.Author: kaizersoze84
Reviews.Content: Ate at the restaurant, the food was great. Also had an amazing view. Walking distance from all of the major historical sites. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Ozan merhaba and tesheskur ederiz”
Reviews.Author: Cherry r
Reviews.Content: me and my husband were in Turkey Istanbul for Second time. Hotel Sevenhills l is situated nearby the most important historic sites of Istanbul. We had a very nice and comfortable room (upgrade without charge for Suite), the staff was so kind and anxious, welcoming the guests with help and great hospitality!Ozy was excellent, he sat down with us and offered us Turkish red wine on our arrival and gave us Tips on local attractions, and answered any questions that we had. IWe felt like I was staying at a friends House; one morning we missed breakfast so we recieved a call saying that they noticed we didnt have breakfast so they sent it to our rooms. Ozan was very kind through out our stay . We were invited to have a Thnaksgiving drink and snack with the other guests, a nice gesture. Thanksgiving day breakfast buffet was served until 12Pm .

Reviews.Title: “Holiday in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Nelli A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Seven Hills Hotel for 8 days. This hotel is amazing and hotel location is perfect. We had a very good room with the most beautiful view. Our room was very big, clean and comfortable. We are very thankful to reception staff, that was very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Seckin Keles for very good service. We highly recommend the Seven Hills Hotel. Kind Regards, Nelli and Aivars

Reviews.Title: “Tesekkurler Seven Hills”
Reviews.Author: Amalia T
Reviews.Content: It's been the 6th or maybe 7th time stayed over Seven Hills. I am constantly visiting Istanbul since 2006, and i cannot think of booking a room elsewhere. Magic location, outstanding view over the sea of Marmara on the one side and the Bosphorus on the other side, local furnishing, and a "family" business type provide the main characteristics of this boutique hotel. My last time was a week ago, next time is planned to be very soon .... Cok tesekkur ederim Seven Hills ! I allways feel like going "home". Amalia - Greece

Reviews.Title: “â€œHotel Sevenhills Sultanahmet was wonderfulâ€�”
Reviews.Author: stefano l
Reviews.Content: This is the five time I have stayed at the Sevenhill over the past 10 years and each time my experience has been similarly positive. There is a wonderful view from the rooftop terrace. What more could one want when eating breakfast than to see the panorama of Blue Mosgue and Hagia Sophia with the Prince Islands and the Marmara Sea . Seven Hills is located on a quiet street just next door Four Season Hotel, which is the main street running through the Sultanahmet neighbourhood. It is less than 10minutes from the Metro station and all of the major sights (Spoice Bazaar,Topkapi. Suleymanie Mosgue,,Grand Bazaar, the Hurrem Sultan Hamam s, and the Medusa Cistern are just a 10-minute walk away. The staff are very pleasant , the hotel is very clean (though the decor is rather old-fashioned) and there is free Internet in the rooms. If you are solo traveling alone and don't want to spend a lot on your hotel, this is a very good choice, as indeed it would be for couples or families. I would definitely stay SEVENHILLS again, and again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “â€œComfortable and Cosyâ€�”
Reviews.Author: david c
Reviews.Content: The Sevenhills Hotel, is a GEM within this Old city. A lovely, central, hotel which provides everything required by the tourist or traveller. Good food in the wonderful terraced restuarant overlooking Blue Mosgue.Hagia Sophia , and Princes Island courteous friendly staff. we found the front desk staff to Helpfull,Terrific friendly , all English speaking and responsive. Most helpful was Ozan , a lovely young boy . This is a well run clean and comfortable hotel with a touch of class, combining traditional and modern facilities. Quite a find in this beautiful city. Free Wifi made it easy for us to stay in touch with family in the states. Would definitely recommend it Seven Hills Hotel who come Istanbul firts time!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the buck with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_bum99
Reviews.Content: Located just a 3-5 min walk from the aya sofra and the blue mosque, this hotel is a small hidden gem, rooms are spacious and hotel staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. The area is close to a lot of major sights which is nice if you like to walk, as well close to neighborhood eateries, bars and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location Amazing Hotel and Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: okan k
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a best location you only need to walk two minutes to see Hagia Sophia Blue Mosque Cistern. I was suprised that was the highest place in old city so spectacular view from the terrace one side facing Blue Mosque one side Marmara sea and hagia sophia. Probably it has best view of the city. The rooms are enough space and and everthing worked well in the room.Hotel staff is always ready to help you.they are very friendly. If you would like have a nice room,best view and friendly people you will not be dissapointed at Seven Hills . I will definitely be back the Seven Hills Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rather disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: DemiTass
Reviews.Content: I felt they were very overpriced for the quality of my stay. Maid service was marginal. I had to ask for towels every day. Food was not great and too pricey. The view on the terrace was magnificant, however, it alone, was not worth the price I paid. I checked out other hotels in the area, and will stay elsewhere on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: oystertravel
Reviews.Content: We spent one night after our long flight from California. We made arrangements with the hotel to pick us up at the airport and they were there. Our room was OK, there was some mold in the bathroom around the edge of the tub and the bed was very hard but the location was great, the breakfast was good and the view from breakfast over the Bosphorous was wonderful. You can walk to Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque and the spice bazaar from here. So if you're able to overlook some imperfections, the price is right for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel in a beautiful city.”
Reviews.Author: dsnewtime
Reviews.Content: I love this little hotel. My son and I stayed here for five days in October 2011, and had a very pleasant and comfortable stay. We were both impressed with the service. The front desk gentleman, whose name, unfortunately, I do not know, was beyond helpful and friendly. All the staff were excellent. We stayed on the first floor, very clean, very comfortable, very quiet. And the location is just perfect. Walking distance to everything. The Four Seasons hotel is right across the street and is, I think, very high end. Seven Hills is not what I would call high end, but it is lovely, and more than adequate for a comfortable stay in Istanbul. Also the rooftop terrace is AMAZING! When we arrived it was late afternoon. We sat and had few drinks and watched the sun going down on the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophya. One of the most beautiful things I have ever seen. Go there. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “â€œNice Hotel and friendly Amaral staff.â€�”
Reviews.Author: 572sammyuk
Reviews.Content: Holiday Seven Hills Hotel is excellent Boutigue star in the hearth of Old Sultanahmet .Hotel is walking distance Hagia Sophia Church and Topkapi Palace etc..room very clean and they have lovely roftop terrace for sitting and eat breakfast view for diePolite and hepfull front desk plus our experience .a special thanks for Ozan for great effort and always smiles us.We highly receomment Seven hills hotel for Western tourist Tesekkur ederhiz

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: tradewinder
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Hills hotel for 4 nights in early May. The location is the best. Steps away from the Aya Sofia and other sights in Sultanahmet, yet a couple of blocks removed from the parallel street where the majority of hotels and touristy restaurants are located (therefore a little quieter). The rooms are fairly large and decorated in a very classical fashion - not the typical wall-to-wall carpets and modular furniture of most 4 and 5 star hotels, but perfectly comfortable. The buffet breakfast - with fabulous views - is quite nice, though it gets a bit monotonous after a few mornings. Service was effective and efficient. A good option if you want to stay in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “The best view from Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Renaux X
Reviews.Content: This place is a must when visiting Istanbul. Not only for the exceptionnal view but also for the very high quality for the restaurant, freshness of the products. Fish is extraordinary, and the wine very good! The service is as usual very attentive and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Sultanahmet's best hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisaburson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 days at Sevenhills hotel, pre-cruise. We were impressed by the outstanding service provided by this small hotel. Hotel has 24Hrs free internet access. The staff has been very helpful, from giving directions to getting your Tour books and suggesting the best restaurant, all with a courteous and cheerful manner. One day, my husband had food poisening, and we got the full attention from the hotel staff and even from the front desk Ozhan. They help me call the doctor to the hotel, and even make arrangements for a taxi driver to go pick up the medications at 05:00AM Madida, when all the regular pharmacies are closed. When the doctor told me I should get some yogurt and boiled potatoes for my husband, I was totally puzzled, since the hotel doesn't have full restaurant service. To my surprise, a hotel staff showed up an hour later at our room, with a tray filled with yogurt and hot boiled potatoes. It's magic! We truly felt like being at home. I certainly recommend sEVENHÄ°LLS hotel to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “great location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: UAEguy
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, the best thing this place has going for it, is the view from their terrace restaurant, it was a fantastic view to enjoy while having a meal. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the location is excellent- only a short walk to most major attractions in Sultanamet. I can not say I was overly impressed with the room we had, there was no mini-bar and other little extras lacking... seemed like a 3-star room, for a 4-star price. Overall a pleasant experience, but I think on my next trip to Istanbul, I would stay somewhere else and just dine at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: LF99
Reviews.Content: What a find! The staff are very kind and warm, and funny too! The fabulous buffet breakfast is served on the rooftop terrace overlooking the Bosphorus, Haghia Sophia, and the Blue Mosque! All the major sites are a stone's throw away! The rooms are large, impeccably clean and quiet. The fish (leverek) in the dining room is the best I've ever had! Can't wait to stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: inez b
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and the people are very friendly. The only but really important thing is that the beds were so hard to sleep on, that every morning we woke up tired and with pain in our body. Also the too hard jet from the shower head was not very nice on your body. We told this to the receptionist of the hotel, he had heard earlier from other clients the same complains. So I really hope the hotel will do something with the complains because it's a really pleasent hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very well located and quiet. Very nice people.”
Reviews.Author: Olivier S
Reviews.Content: There are (at least) two ways to enjoy a short trip in Istanbul: either going out, shopping and having good time in the incredibly active night life of this very cosmopolitan city or visiting a small selection of the huge diversity of its wonderful historical sites. For the first choice, try to find an hotel in Taksim district, â€¦but don't expect to sleep before 3:00 AMâ€¦.soâ€¦.we choose the second option and select Sultanahmet district, very closed to numerous historical sites (Hagia Sophia Museum, Basilica Cistern, the blue mosque, Topkapi Palaceâ€¦etc). We end up in the Seven Hills Hotel with the help of TripAdvisor and it turned out to be an excellent choice. It is located just nearby Hagia Sophia Museum and the blue mosque. We stayed for 3 nights and all people we met in the hotel were extremely nice to us. We booked for a Superior double room for 185 Euros per night. At arrival, I noticed that room prices at hotel desk were higher (230 euros if I remember correctly) but on top of it, when we arrived at the hotel, we were offered a suite for the two first nights (â€¦we were "a romantic couple"â€¦was the reason we were givenâ€¦?!?). In the end we were also offered the third night and all that without asking anything. I don't think this can happens to everyone but at least, it tells they really did their best for us. Receptionists were all very nice and took the time to teach us the minimal Turkish language we wanted (completely useless as everyone speaks good English, but we had a lot of fun trying our best speaking Turkish).Our airlines lost one of our suitcases, receptionists organised phone calls and delivery to the hotel on their own. The room (actually the suiteâ€¦) was very nice (a surprising "ottoman style" may be, but charming), clean and quiet at night (although above the street, it is a quiet street). We had a small Jacuzzi as a bathtub â˜ºâ€¦and that was nice too. We had a short look in the Superior double room: it was of course smaller but would have been really OK as well ('didn't look how the bathroom was). Well, all that to say that I can only recommend that hotel. The hotel also has a roof terrace with one of the very best view on the see, Hagia Sophia and the blue mosque (slightly higher than surrounding roof terraces from other hotels). We didn't have lunch or diner at the restaurant of the hotel, but breakfast were very nice (large fruit choice, cheeses, sausages, honeyâ€¦etc). We had a drink one time in the night (Whisky and Baileys, so they do serve alcohol contrary to what somebody noticed before).

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Danil Y
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 5 or 6 times for last several years. Actually, the Seven Hills hotel its a 2 different stories: the hotel which is really good and not overpriced. And the Restaurant with the fabulous roof, view to Aya Sophia, Blue Moscque and the Bosphorus. The stuff is very friendly, ready to help in any needs 24 hours. Thanks, Danil

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderfull Service”
Reviews.Author: Corrin S
Reviews.Content: The service here we got was unbelievable, the view of the terrace and the staff was very helpful. Also the location is perfect. We want to visit there again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! Best service and location! Amazing terrasse!”
Reviews.Author: Suntraveler41
Reviews.Content: Had the most amazing time in Istanbul and really recommend the Seven Hills Hotel. The service is great and efficient, certainly beyond expectations. All the staff is very friendly and helpfull. The location is perfect, walking distance from the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia, the Topkapi Palace and the Grand Bazar! Also walking distance from the tram station bringing you everywhere else you may want to go. The Hotel also has the best roof top terasse restaurant in old Istanbul, the highest terrasse and the most amazing view on the Blue Mosque, the Hagia Sophia and the Bosphore! Even if you decide not to book this Hotel you need to go eat on their roof top terasse! If I go back to Istanbul I know where to go! I recommend this Hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: evdokimos
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice friendly staff and......THE BEST view of Istanbul from the terrace!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Catherine32704
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. Location is perfect ---can walk to major attractions or take tram to other parts of city. The room was very comfortable and quiet. The staff was terrific ---very helpful on directions and were very personable.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: worthwhile1
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul for the first time with my wife, who had visited Istanbul several times before. We spent 3 weeks at Seven Hills Hotel, from Mar. 9 to Mar. 28, and totally enjoyed the experience. We chose to stay on the 3rd Floor because one of the reviews indicated that it might be advisable to avoid the 4th floor, on account of noise from the restaurant above. The 3rd Floor was an excellent choice. From our room on the 3rd Floor, we had a lovely view of the Aya Sofya. The hotel is in walking distance to the Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, as well as lots of restaurants and shopping. I even walked to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market; these sites are farther away, but they can be accessed easily by Tram, at very little cost. Breakfast was included, and it was a real treat every morning having breakfast in a pleasant environment, with a beautiful view of the Sea of Marmara, with ships coming and going through the Bosphorous, as well as a stunning view of the Aya Sofya, and maybe the Blue Mosque, depending on where one was seated. The restaurant is open for dinner as well, and it is quite a treat. The view from the restaurant at night is even more fabulous. The staff working at reception, including Sedat, Seckin and Cengiz, were very helpful. Their service was truly outstanding. Our stay at the Seven Hills Hotel was a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice butik hotel in Istanbul, overlooking the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia, above the 4 seasons”
Reviews.Author: Juan_in_Pretoria
Reviews.Content: Great find in tripadvisor. "Bestest" location no doubt. Excellent service and very complete for a boutique Istanbul hotel. Will come back since the city is a magnet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location! Perfect price! Perfect peace!”
Reviews.Author: DLDZ
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Seven Hills is on a quiet side street right between the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque which makes it easy to walk and tour the area. The price includes a great breakfast, clean rooms and an amazing view. Sedat and all the receptionists and personnel were super friendly and accomodating. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quaint Hotel, great service.”
Reviews.Author: IZZYScotland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Seven Hills. A lovely quaint hotel, great veiws from the roof top restaurant, lovely breakfast too. We had a wonderful time, the staff were so helpful and friendly, even arranged for a car to pick us up from the Airport. The rooms were comfortable and large, bathroom adequate but dont try to run a bath, takes forever to fill!! Our only gripe was, on the very large Suoer King Bed there was a King Size Duvet!! it didnt even reach to both sides of the bed, so to keep warm we had to lie together in the middle, very cozy! Other than that I would recommend this hotel. It is in a great area, so close to lots of the interesting sights, just take earplugs if you dont want to be woken up at 5 am every morning with the very loud call to prayer from the Blue Mosque of Aya Sofia!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely charming hotel wuth a very pleasant and dedicated staff”
Reviews.Author: SOFIAMESS
Reviews.Content: Perfect location (close to all main historical/ tourisitc places Very good quality/ price ratio Enjoyable deck with beautiful view (Blue Mosc & Bosphore) Staff available and very pleasant Comfortable and large rooms

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has a friendly, family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: arnie001
Reviews.Content: I loved the charm & character of the hotel. The location was perfect & the rooftop view was spectacular. The staff were very helpful & funny. The food was beautiful. I would most definitely recommend anyone to stay here. The best rooms are on the 3rd & 4th floor as you have a balcony

Reviews.Title: “It felt like home”
Reviews.Author: suzidoucha
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a snowy day feeling the affects of jet lag and was immediately upgraded to a deluxe room with a balcony facing the Ayasophia. My room was superb with a fantastic view of everything and even had a delightful jacuzzi. The staff at the hotel were by far some of the most helpful, wonderful people I've ever come across in my travels. The location couldn't be better and everything about this hotel was high quality. I loved it and recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Best in town”
Reviews.Author: Donjimbocito
Reviews.Content: Welcoming - Cosy - best view - very good food - clean Seckin - Sedat - Memet and Rahmi will surely do their best for your stay to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: PopeJohn
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Seven Hills Hotel. We discovered it when a friend who worked at the British Consulate in Istanbul, recommended it. The location in the Sultanahmet (Old Istanbul) area is ideal for many main tourist sites (inc. Topkapi, The Bazaar), and it is surrounded by many excellent restaurants - including the Seven Hills own rooftop restaurant (where you also have breakfast), with spectacular views of the Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmet Camii) on one side and Ayasofya (Hagia Sophia) on the other, against the backdrop of the Sea of Marmara. Both rooms I've been in were well furnished, and were larger than I'd expected, with comfortable beds and spacious bathrooms. The free wi-fi was a bonus, when so many hotels charge exorbitant rates for this. Breakfast is a large self-service buffet, with a variety of foods available. The staff in the hotel are very welcoming, and go out of their way to make your stay memorable - nothing is too much trouble for them. The only downsides worth noting are the small lift (max 4 persons?), and, as with most hotels in Turkey, the proximity to the mosque does ensure you get an early morning call from the muezzin whether you want one or not! Finally I'm returning at the end of March - need I say more!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 2_bedroom_suite
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my room in the Seven Hills Hotel. The location could not be better- across the street from the Four Seasons, steps away from the major tourist attractions. Restaurants, shops and cafes all around within easy walking distance. The staff is incredibly helpful, and the rooms are very nice. The doorman took us shopping last night and showed us the best places to eat, told us what a fair price was for various items and helped us to negotiate with vendors. The restaurant in this hotel is amazing (reviewed under restaurants). We simply could not be more satisfied with a hotel at any price, but it sure helps to feel that we're getting a good deal, which I know that we are! We are traveling with two small children, and were upgraded to an available Presidential Suite at no extra charge! Of course, I wouldn't expect that they could do that for everyone, and it certainly helps that we're in low season and there are plenty of vacant rooms in town, but we didn't even ask for the upgrade, it was their idea! In short, if you like the personal service of a smaller, boutique hotel a one to two minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia, want true international four star quality and fantastic service, you can't go wrong with the Seven Hills Hotel. We are planning a longer trip to Turkey, maybe next year, certainly when it's warmer, but we'll be staying at the Seven Hills Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GPSJMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights, and while the hotel was okay, we were disappointed with many aspects. I'll start with the positives. The hotel is in a fantastic location, and the staff members are friendly. Unfortunately, this wouldn't be enough for us to return to this hotel. We reserved the Blue Mosque double for two nights. At 11:30 PM that night, they called our room to inform us that there would be construction in it in the early morning, so we would have to relocate rooms immediately. They moved us to the suite (which sounds like it would be good); however, this room had no view of either the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia (the main reason we chose this hotel). When we were relocated to our original room the next night, we couldn't sleep at all. We were on the 4th floor, and the restaurant is on the 5th floor. Literally, all night long, we could hear what was going on above us--even long after the restaurant closed, we could still hear workers cleaning up. We heard every chair that was dragged along the floor. We could also smell everything from the kitchen. Our room had a fishy odor for several hours, followed by an intense smoky/charred odor in the middle of the night. This odor was so intense that it woke me up, and I had to open the window to air it out. I also noticed that the photos on their website do not match up with what is seen in person. Even the photo of the outside is inaccurate (it shows the 3rd floor and the restaurant, but not the 4th floor!). The photo of our room was inaccurate as well. The furniture is different and has been rearranged so that the bed does not face the Blue Mosque. There was not even a nightstand next to the bed. For the money we paid, I was expecting more.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in perfect loaction”
Reviews.Author: DubaiCarolP
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills Hotel is a small quaint hotel with the most fantatic panoramic views across Istanbul. Rooms are spacious, clean and welcoming. Staff friendly well versed in the local knowledge. Their roof terrace restaurant is excellent and it was quite a site to have breakfast on the terrace looking across the Marmara Sea, The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. Most of the key sights were within minutes walk from the hotel and the area has a wealth of good restaurants. Highly recommended is the Palatium Cafe and Restaurant at the end of the cobbled street bythe hotel, this cafe serves excellent Apple Tea and of course Turkish Coffee, beneth the cafe they have excavated rooms and cellars which date back to 4th century. Musts to see are The Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia. For a quick city break Seven Hills and Istanbul is ideal. We travelled durnoig Eid so many Bazaars and Restaurants were closed but still plenty to do. Within 100 yards fo the hotel were 3 mosques so call to prayer was heard but all part of the experince

Reviews.Title: “Great views and location.”
Reviews.Author: marilynferguson2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful 6 night stay at the lovely Seven Hills Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey in October 2010. If you are looking for a small boutique hotel within walking distance of all the major historic attractions, we highly recommend that you stay here, The roof top terrace and restaurant offer breathtaking panoramic views of the Sea of Marmara as well as the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. The breakfast buffet and the seafood restaurant were excellent. The room were spacious and beautifully decorated. The hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The General Manager went out of way to help us plan our itinerary. The staff made our stay very special.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: noosasunshine
Reviews.Content: 3 Delightful night at this great hotel, right opposite The Four Seasons Hotel. A Deluxe Double Suite gave us plenty of space ,Bathroom above average size. The restaurant on the roof , as well as the views was spectacular , Staff very good and helpful, Do not miss staying at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: itchyfootAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel Septermber, 2010. The location could not have been better. It was between Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. There were a number of shops close by, a bazaar only a couple of blocks away. There were also several restaurants in the area. The roof-top deck had a fabulous view. The breakfast buffet was extensive. The staff was very accomodating in addition to being friendly and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, hospitable, staff without exception.”
Reviews.Author: happyrelaxeddudes
Reviews.Content: This intimate hotel has a great location for touring the old city. Everything is in walking distance and our room had a great view of the Aya Sophia, a block away. The restaraunt roof view is unsurpassed! - Aya Sophia, The Blue Mosque, the Topkapi Palace on one side and wqater views on the other. The most impressive feature of the hotel, however, was its excellent staff. We worked with the reservation manager for several weeks before our trip to arrange for a private tour guide, to make dinner reservations, to make show reservations, and to make transport arrangements. She had great suggestions and was extremely helpful. We were also impressed with the other members of the staff. The front desk staff was welcoming, warm and very accomodating. The staff went out of their way to make sure that we had an enjoyable stay, including having the restaraunt personnel come in early so that we could have breakfast before our 6:00 AM transportaion to the airport! All in all a great place to stay when touring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: SoCalcruisegal
Reviews.Content: Front desk personnel really go out of their way to take care of the guests. We were given top service for directions, obtaining cabs, and getting a late check out. I definately recommend this hotel for its service and location.

Reviews.Title: “grest hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: queenslandtraveller
Reviews.Content: great hotel with great staff at hotel and great location. Central to all the sights abd can be walked to easily lots of restaurants but can be a little noisy with all the tourists in the streets below, Great views from restaurant on the roof and contrary to Lonely Planet's review food was quite good. In actual fact the breakfast that was provided was very good

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location with genuine hospitality”
Reviews.Author: WildWestShep
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this hotel isn't higher up the ratings. The location in old town Sultanhamet is perfect and a very short stroll brings you to the entrances of all 3 of the major sites - Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace. The roof terrace must have the best views in all of the old town, being higher than most and with a 360 degree panorama. The food is delicious and the waiting staff courteous and entertaining. Front Office staff helped us plan our days and negotiated with a private guide to take us around the main places of interest and to introduce us to the history and life of Istanbul. Seemed extravagant when we booked it but we got so much more out of the day than we would have done with a standard sightseeing package. We booked a standard double room which was a good size with all amenities. Since the hotel is in an old building I assume that all rooms will be slightly different, but I have no doubt that they will all be clean , comfortable and well furnished with a little bit of character.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel - No better location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: ElPasoCPG
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Istanbul for our honeymoon and loved this place. The hotel is literally 1 block from the blue mosque and hagia sophia, two blocks from the main tram line and surrounded by resturaunts, bars, and shopping. The staff was the best of any hotel I have ever stayed at, especially for a tourist wanting to get good advise on what to do and how to get around. GM called when we arrived, met us in the morning and made sure all our tours and shopping were handled appropriately. DO NOT MISS the resturaunt! it has a 360 view of the city at dome-level of the blue mosque and hagia sophia. Call to prayer over dinner is about the coolest thing ever. The rooms were confortable and nice, but not the most modern room ever. However, that did not limit our enjoyment. Location and service was well worth the price. We were very happy with the Seven Hills for the most important trip of our live.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: laurelt
Reviews.Content: These folks go out of their way to make sure that their guests are treated right. The location is perfect for sightseeing and the rooftop restaurant is a wonderful place to start your day off with breakfast -- what a view!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: baracuda54
Reviews.Content: My wife & I recently stayed at The Seven Hills Hotel in Istanbul, Turkey. The location is perfect, the rooms are pleasant & clean, the staff is friendly & extremely helpful, & the restaurant is fantastic. The view from the roof top is beautiful with the Blue Mosque on one side & the Aya Sophia on the other. Our stay there was perfect. Will definitely recommend The Seven Hills to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view - fantastic food - wonderfully friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: LondontravelerLondon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 150m/yds from Aya Sofya and the terrace and restaurant have uninterrupted 360 degree views of the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and the Bosphorus - fabulous! The food was delicious - probably the best swordfish and calamari we've ever had. All the staff were exceptionally welcoming - the young lads at the door and serving in the restaurant, the senior restaurant staff and the receptionists/concierges were especially friendly and helpful. One them, Seckin, was amazing when we got stuck due to volcanic ash - he could not have done more to help us in every way and we will always remember the difference he made to our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate, just book your stay at the Seven Hills!”
Reviews.Author: janetcan41
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seven Hills Hotel during December 2009, and I highly recommend this property in Istanbul. My room was clean and cozy, with a comfortable king-size bed, good linens, a spacious bathroom and a water view. The windows open in the rooms so you can enjoy fresh air throughout the night. Also, the room had a mini fridge, so you can have cool beverages and a snack in your suite. I saw a couple of other rooms at the hotel, and both were quite large, with lovely water or city views. The Seven Hills Hotel is located in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, steps away from the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia; the location cannot be beat, and the hotel has an absolutely stunning view of these two sites from itâ€™s roof-top restaurant. The view is better than that at the Four Seasons across the street. For a first time visit to Istanbul, all the main tourist sites are within short walking distance, including the Topkapi Palace, the Cistern, the Hippodrome, the mosaic museum, and so much more. An easy walk along Divan Youlu (approximately 20 minutes, longer if you shop along the way) will lead you to the Grand Bazaar. Just exploring the Sultanahmet neighbourhood is a treat too. As for the common complaint about carpet salesmen (or impromptu tour guides, or both) bothering tourists â€“ itâ€™s true, particularly in Sultanahmet Park, which is between the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. A firm â€œno thank youâ€� should suffice, and just keep moving. I did consider advice to stay in the Taksim Square area to avoid this problem, but am glad I didnâ€™t. In addition to the fantastic stay I had at the Seven Hills Hotel itself, I liked the convenience of being right where the major attractions are found, and frankly, if you have to travel to the area, then you are going to encounter these salesmen regardless of your hotel location. In fact, after a couple of days exploring the area, most of the salesmen recognize you and either leave you alone, or better yet, they strike-up casual conversation that no longer feels pressured! The staff at the Seven Hills Hotel is great. Seckin, Bulent, and their team offer warm and relaxed hospitality; they make you feel like you are staying with friends. I have not experienced such genuine hospitality in all my years of international travel. Do check with them for tips on the best places to pick-up certain Turkish specialties â€“ my friends still rave about the Turkish delight that I brought home from my tripâ€¦I would not have found the particular shop without assistance from Seckin! Also, the hotel can arrange car service to/from the airport, and bill the charge to your room tab. As a woman travelling alone, I took advantage of this offer, and the pick-up upon my arrival went smoothly. I have recommended the Seven Hills Hotel to friends, and I look forward to staying at this pleasant and relaxing hotel upon my return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “10 thumbs up;)”
Reviews.Author: charbs9
Reviews.Content: I have been told that the people in Istanbul are very warm and sincere. I find this however to be an understatement. My stay at this hotel has shown me just how good natured a human can be. The strategic location was a definite plus, waking up to the majestic sight of the blue mosque and aya sofea. Every morning I find myself up early just to indulge in their delightful breakfast, while being mesmerized by the beautiful view Bosphorus sea. The staff were incredible, always going the extra mile to ensure that our stay there would be a memorable one. From the well mannered concierges to the friendly uncle who makes breakfast every morning with smile on his face, my trip to Istanbul would not have been this fulfilling had I not stayed here. Thus I would without a doubt recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul be it with family or friends, for I certainly have no regrets. I have never written a review for a hotel before, this would be my first. The hotels I visited during my prior vacations do not match to the amazing hospitality I received here, and I truly wish to visit it again!

Reviews.Title: “Want the best hotel in Istanbul? Look no further...”
Reviews.Author: PRalphes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Hills for 5 nights, arriving at midnight on Christmas day 2009. It is a fantastic hotel in every respect. The staffâ€™s attentiveness began even before we arrived as I exchanged a few emails before our stay with the manager Seckin .He and all of the staff were incredibly friendly, polite, efficient and helpful. You are really made to feel like part of a family in this elegant boutique hotel. I had been initially confused by the sheer number of aparently good hotel options for Istanbul, but if you are a tourist, look no further. The positioning is perfect, walking distance from the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Basilica Cisterns, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, and Arasta Bazaar. The view from the terrace, where the fantastic breakfast is served is amazing and listed on some Top 10 Must see lists of Istanbul. Some other tips? If you like Indian food try Dubb Restaurant, itâ€™s amazing and very reasonable. The Arasta Bazaar is great and much more tranquil than the Grand Bazaar. There is a nice record stall with some great Turkish Cds. There is also an open air restaurant there that has Live Whirling Dervish performances for free. If you fancy a trip to the Asian side of the City, get a ferry to the Old Railway station. Recently used in the Chanel Advert. We had a wonderful time in Istanbul and a perfect time at the Seven Hills. Elegant and clean with fantastically friendly staff, I would recommend it to anyone. I enjoyed my stay so much, I actually wrote this review, which is the first time I have ever done this about a hotel. Thanks a lot and I hope we can stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel with Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: valezerrin
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Seven Hills Hotel from the 19th â€“ 24th of December. I canâ€™t say enough about this hotel or their customer service. We have never received such personal service as Seckin Keles offered us at Seven Hills. In all our years of traveling he has by far been the most attentive hotel staff employee we have come across; this is including numerous visits to Four Seasonâ€™s hotels as well. Any questions we had no matter how many, they were always very helpful and took out the time to answer all of our questions. Besides their customer service, the hotel itself is very quaint and nice. My boyfriend and I love boutique hotels and this has been one our favorites. The rooms are very clean and have great views. We stayed in one the suites which was a very nice room. The room had great views of the Marmara Sea and Hagia Sophia. The breakfast which is included in the package is also very good. My boyfriend really enjoyed it since they served breakfast potatoes and sausages. I enjoyed the vegetables, bread and olives they served. The restaurant is very delicious. My boyfriend who will NOT eat fish actually really liked the fish I had, so you know itâ€™s good!!! The wait staff at night is very friendly and has great service. The views at night are amazing!!! If you are tiered the restaurant is also a good place to go and just relax and have a drink before you retire for the night. The location of the hotel is sooooo convenient. You can walk to all the major sites. We are going back to Turkey in a year with our parents and are already planning on returning to Seven Hills. After spending two weeks in Europe, staying at this hotel and seeing the sites in Turkey was a great end to our vacation. Also, the store right next to our hotel has great jewelry and carpets. If you stay at the hotel make sure to stop by the store next door. There is also a great cafe down the street called Cafe Mesala that has really good food and a great environment. Also, the hotel provides free internet :)

Reviews.Title: “The best boutique hotel in service and location.”
Reviews.Author: Culture-Fan
Reviews.Content: If you want great service, food and location you can't beat this hotel. It is a small privately owned hotel that I think has the best view of Istanbul you could ever want. It is located in the historic district of Sultanahmet and literally within walking distance of all the major sites. I think the longest walking distance was 10 minutes to get to the Grand Bizarre. Everything else was right there. The restaurant is known for its seafood and was superb. The breakfast was a feast in itself and included in the price of the room. This was my second visit to this hotel and I enjoyed it more the second time around. Did I mention the great service. Whatever we needed or wanted the staff at the hotel took care of it. They were very courteous and prompt in helping us. This hotel is right across the street (a small cobblestone street) from the Four Season Hotel and I can say the view from this hotel was 100 times better than the Four Seasons. Bottom Line: This is a must stay hotel in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, amazing service!!”
Reviews.Author: HaseenaDublin
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommended this location! Great view and amazing staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: TimInNYC
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, there was a mixup and our room was unavailable. We were upset and we were not pleased. The staff seemed to take that as a challenge and they went out of their way to be helpful. The manager personally found us another room in another hotel for that night. He walked us to the hotel, went with us to see the room and then had our luggage moved to the other hotel (and back the next morning). He made all the payment arrangements with the other hotel so we only had to deal with his hotel. In short, he turned us from very unhappy and disappointed guests to ones who are willing to write this note to tell everyone how helpful he and his staff were. If you don't require the glamor of the Four Seasons Hotel (next door) and want a taste of the great hospitality of the Turkish people, then check into the Seven Hills Hotel. The location is terrific for seeing the old town, there are plenty of good restaurants within a few blocks of the hotel, and there are plenty of neighborhood shops. Tell we said "hello."

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lullabella
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Seven hills hotel. From start to finish the staff couldn't do enough for us. I spent my birthday there and the manager insisted on treating us to a drink (6 of us) and then they brought up a cake and made such a fuss of me. They were fantastic. The situation was perfect - food was very good. Our room wasn't perfect but overall we would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: scaevolaBudapest
Reviews.Content: Perfect location ( 1 minute walking to Hagia Sophia, 2 minutes walking to the Blue Mosque, 2 minutes walk to Topkapi etc. etc.), perfect staff, perfect kitchen, rooftop restaurant - VERY good value for money! We will stay there each time we come to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GH2009
Reviews.Content: Like so many people planning a trip to a city that I'd not been to before, choosing the right accommodation was just about putting my head into a spin. The fact that my wife and I were on our honeymoon made it even more perplexing for my choice. Let me start by suggesting you can't go wrong with Seven Hills. It's central location, friendly staff and more than adequately kept rooms make it an ideal choice when travelling to Istanbul. The cherry on the cake would certainly have to be the roof top terrace with its stunning views of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and surrounds. whether it was breakfast or dinner time, it was a view worth the stay. I initially was looking at some of the so-called 5 star establishments with brand name reputations and in the end chose Seven Hills based on location, convenience, and feedback from this website amongst others. What Seven Hills misses in luxury it more than adequately compensates with its extremely friendly staff, warmth and charm in character. I certainly can't thank them enough as they made our stay in Istanbul memorable in so many ways. We certainly have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and look forward to returning again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel we ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: jpWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am very particular and have stayed at many 5 star hotels but The Seven Hills Hotel will always be remembered fondly. We were upgraded to a suite but told we would have to move if someone wants to reserve it which was fine with us. The room was huge and very clean and comfortable. I can't imagine why someone said the breakfast was not good. The breakfast buffet was amazing including freshly made omlets if you request them. Homemade jams were outstanding and the gentleman who takes care of the breakfast was delightful. What really made our stay special was the front desk staff. Never have we been treated with such kindness and warmth, believe me you won't get that at the five star hotel across the street. We felt like we were staying with family not at a hotel. The location could not be more perfect. Thank you to everyone at Seven HIlls for making our stay in Istanbul even more special than the city itself. Istanbul is an amazing place, I'm ready to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome”
Reviews.Author: ilantlv
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite at an annex part of the seven hills hotel, just across the street, called "seven dreams" hotel. We were offered to stay there when we made the reservation a few weeks prior to the trip, since the hotel itself was fully booked. This part is totally newly rennovated, and even though there is no direct sea or mosque view, the room was extraordinary. It was a spacious suite, with a comfortable king size bed, a jacuzzi just near the sleeping area, a beautiful glass shower and a desk area. The room had pretty big windows, and a balcony covered with a grapevine, overlooking the small street - just charming. Overall, this room was a 5 stars quality. The breakfast was served at the rooftop seven hills restaurant, which has fantastic views like everyone here mentioned. The buffet has good selection and service is efficiant and friendly. The location, as mentioned in all reviews, is perfect. Just a minute walk to the main attractions of Istanbul and many cute restaurants around. Even a taxi to Taxim, if you want to change the atmosphere a bit, is just 10 minutes. The only problem we had is that being in the annex, you dont have reception services like in the main seven hills hotel. Also when we arrived, the receptionist of the seven hills hotel didnt have our reservation, but after we showed him our email correspondance with his boss, everything was resolved, To sum it up - I actually recommend the annex part even more, since it has beautifuly designed delux rooms. I recommend the management just to make sure all services are integrated there to make the experience perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Stay there - it's great.”
Reviews.Author: jwoodruff45
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 5 days at this hotel. The service and food was excellent; the staff went out of their way to make sure we had everything we wanted. The unobstructed views of the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia at breakfast can't be beat. The hotel is central to many of the city highlights, and close to restaurants and the bazaars.

Reviews.Title: “Location & views best part of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: loumorri
Reviews.Content: I should have been warned when I received an email from the hotel saying "it would be a non smoking room as you wish." There was a "no smoking" sign in the room - but also a strange odor - could it have been a spray to remove the smoke smell? We had booked the largest room. Yes, there was a sitting area, but the couch was placed about 2 feet from a wall with windows higher than your sight line. The TV, which seemed to not have any channels in English, was at right angles to the couch and could only be viewed from the bed, which was too far for comfortable viewing. The worst part was the "step down" living space which was about 1 inch lower than the perimeter of the room, so walking from one area to another was a constant game of stumbling and toe stubbing. They must have been economizing on electricity because the lighting was uncomfortably dim. A call for luggage racks brought the response that they had none, but they did bring a chair from the upstairs restaurant for us to use as a luggage rack. There was water of an unexplained origin on the bathroom floor and a drinking glass with water in it on the counter of the nice sized bathroom, which led us to doubt the merits of housekeeping. Breakfast the next morning was a dismal affair with watered down lukewarm coffee from a machine and a sorry array of processed meats and bananas cut in half. To their credit, the desk clerk tried to find us another room (they were filled) without the step down, but the room he showed us was considerably smaller. A request for an extra blanket brought one thrown onto our bed that looked like it had been retrieved from another room. There was a great view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop space, but that was not enough to make us stay there the other 3 nights we had booked.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, otherwise good”
Reviews.Author: dsjoerg
Reviews.Content: The staff were all very warm and friendly, especially to our two-year-old daughter. The location was quite good, close to the top 3 Istanbul tourist attractions. Also near some playgrounds that our daughter enjoyed. If you are prepared for a steady stream of minor annoyances, you will be fine. For example: * Did not respect the Do Not Disturb sign on multiple occasions * They were doing construction on the roof, therefore we could not get the room that we booked and paid for * A/C did not work in first room * Windows do not block out the street noise * Hot water ran out one morning * They said that we could have a particular room when we return from a 2-day trip to Cappadocia, but when we returned, it wasn't available. * Card keys failed multiple times. They gave us new ones which failed as well, and then a metal key that didnt work either. * Called for a laundry bag. Half an hour later, went down to get it myself. * Asked the staff to confirm a restaurant address, turned out he had only confirmed the street name. If you want a hotel that will make sure that every detail is perfect, this is not the place for you. If, however, you are prepared to tolerate some friendly bungling, then this is a perfectly reasonable base for your Istanbul adventures. Other good things: * laptop & internet in lobby for guest use * front desk happy to make restaurant reservations for you * cleaning staff spoke enough English that we could communicate with them * great views

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: cstarz
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay. Wonderful food. Fantastic location. Special thanks to the entire restaurant staff and to front desk attendant Sedat and to Ismail at the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Ask for Anything Better”
Reviews.Author: Illinois73
Reviews.Content: The Seven Hills Hotel was a true find in an already amazing city. Even before we arrived, the manager was emailing us with tips and helping us figure out our plans. He also lowered the price of the presidential room to ensure our satisfaction. Then, when we arrived the staff couldn't have been kinder. They took care of us in every way. We felt like we were staying with our family as they made sure we had everything we needed. I would absolutely recommend this hotel for its location, its rooftop restaurant, its beautiful rooms, and most importantly its amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Most Incredible Time!”
Reviews.Author: mwodziak
Reviews.Content: Had the most wonderful time at this hotel. The rooms were perfect as was the location. But the highlight of the stay were the hotel staff. They were simply amazing. In fact, I do not consider them to be hotel staff, but now, after a 10 day stay, they are my friends. I will see them again next time I travel to Istanbul. Special shouts to Cengiz and Seckin who were amazing hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: lovecapri
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills Hotel is by far our best choice to stay in Istanbul Old town. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. We arrived early in the morning, and they allowed us to check in right away since the room is ready. That was extremely helpful. We have a standard room with a king bed with a generous space. Rooftop restaurant has a spectacular view of Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. Breakfast is good, lots of fruit. In fact, everything is fantastic except occasionally (1 day of 3 days we stayed), we noticed the bathroom has a bit odor because of the old town system. They do have a fast free internet available in the lobby- one laptop and no one is using it. We would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it to friends and fellow travelers who have limited time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting to experience Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Burton94
Reviews.Content: Absolutely THE perfect location in Istanbul. Spacious and comfortable rooms. Friendly service. Do not miss having dinner on the rooftop restaurant. The fish is delectable and the Four Seasons across the street cannot match the view and setting.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a view! Amazing location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: catsfizog
Reviews.Content: In terms of location I couldn't quite believe this place is really where it claimed to be - but it was. Sandwiched between the Blue Mosque and Haglia Sofia, it could not have been much more central or have a better view. We stayed in the Marmara Suite which my fella selected because he knows I love the sea and arriving some time before him I laughed out loud. The room was lovely and the 3 walls of glass (of which 2 took in sweeping vistas of the Marmara) was beautiful. What someone failed to mention was that the third window framed Haglia Sofia perfectly. I arrived very early for check in and the fabulous and attentive staff gave me a room to work in whilst they readied the suite. The room I was in was large and nicely done out and perfectly nice. The suite however was just lovely. Not the most modern or stylish but who cares with that view (marred only slightly by the hotel just in front of it - it's Istanbul that's the way it goes.) We did have a couple of problems - the aircon didn't work and they had to get an engineer out to fix it but they were hugely apologetic and offered me a free drink in their restaurant. Going upstairs to their rooftop was worth the aircon not working because it' an AMAZING view. You breakfast there (which a really delicious buffet breakfast) and it's delightful. After that there was water in the bathroom (due to aircon I assume) and for some reason the staff didn't make up our room claiming we'd had the 'do not disturb' sign on, however despite these things that might have had me giving a very poor review the attentive, genuine solicitation of the lovely chap on reception and all the staff - plus the location/view means I still had a wonderful time and recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gulcen
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, excellent hospitality, amazing friendliness, superb views all made our trip to Istanbul worth while and unforgetable. We enjoyed our trip very much and Seven Hills made it all possible, starting with the lovely and generous hospitality and of course a nice comfortable night of sleep and a wonderful and delicious breakfast overlooking the most beautiful views were a delight. One couldn't be in a better location to explore such an interesting city and just a step away to a wonderful "fish" restaurant. When in Turkey, one must stay at the Seven Hills Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: L-Austin-Boojah
Reviews.Content: At breakfast, should I look at the Blue Mosque or Hagia Sophia? Those were the choices, with seagulls sailing around the minatets.
