Our rooftop restaurant looked down on the Four Seasons, acrosss the street, where you could stay at ten times the cost. After four days there, I feel I have a new neighborhood of friends. I have a wonderful leather jacket from Oktai's shop -- he also sells beautiful carpets -- and Saleh gave me wonderful, useful tips about getting around and getting a haircut. In the hotel, Seckin was my everyday saviour and Cemil is the best headwaiter ever. Ask him for an omelet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very good service.”
Reviews.Author: Bridgetown
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills Hotel was recommended to us and we now know why. We had an enjoyable stay and the roof deck is arguably the best in Istanbul, with wonderful views of two of the city's most famous sights. The manager and the staff were very helpful and we will certainly stay at Seven Hills again when we go back to Istanbul. Michael and Jennifer Weetch.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location only topped by the superb staff made our stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: MERCARLSBAD
Reviews.Content: After careful research I decided on a booking at the Seven Hills Hotel for my husband, myself and our traveling companions. Bulent, the general manager via e-mail provided an indepth description of the various rooms available and helped us select which would suit us the best. We were each very pleased when we arrived. Bulent also arranged all of our private tours and transfers while in Istanbul based upon our previous correspondence months in advance. Everything that we confirmed with him was arranged as promised. The hotel is wonderfully situated in the old city within walking distance to anything that interested us or within close proximity of public transportation. Secklin, the receptionist, cheerfully assisted us with any additional reservations and the securing of taxis at reasonable rates. Although we stayed four nights in Istanbul, we look forward to returning and will definitely book at the Seven Hills Hotel. The complimentary breakfast each morning on the rooftop terrace is not to be missed for starting off your day in this city and at least one dinner should be enjoyed for the evening view!

Reviews.Title: “Seven Hills is Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: paulynyc
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills is a fabulous hotel. It is located in the perfect neighborhood, and is just moments away from the most magnificent part of Istanbul. We have traveled alot, and have never been anywhere where the entire staff is as accommodating as at the Seven Hills. Every single person knew our name, our itinerary, and everything about us. We had a tour booked that got screwed up, and instead of us scrambling, Boulert the hotel manager took an entire day and showed us around himself. We simply couldn't believe it! Our room was great, and a perfect respite from our daily excursions. The views from the restaurant are simply unbelievable. They gave us great restaurant recommendations, and even sent someone with us to show us around when I couldn't figure out the map :) We loved Istanbul and a huge contributor was the warmth and sense of family that was provided by the staff of Seven Hills. We walked into the Four Seasons across the street, and were so happy we chose Seven Hills instead. It's so much more authentic, beautiful, and inviting. Couldn't speak highly enough of this hotel and recommend it wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful in every way.”
Reviews.Author: BeeEVirginia
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills Hotel was recommended to us by a friend who had loved it previously. We were treated beautifully by some of the kindest people in the world. Our room was pretty and spacious and the view from the rooftop restaurant has to be one of the best on the planet. Plus, it's perfectly located. We love Seven Hills Hotel and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: AKR1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seven Hills hotel for 5 days during our family vacation (kids 11 & 16) in Istanbul. Great location, our balcony was literally 10 meters from the Four Seasons with great views of the Marmara sea and the Haghia Sophia mosque. Very good service and most importantly, a great room for 4 (the Presidential Suite). For a superb location in Sultanahmet at a reasonable price (less than half of the Four Seasons next door) this place is a great deal. The restaurant also has to be mentioned. Perhaps the finest view from a restaurant ever. We had breakfast there daily but the evening view and ambiance is something else. We ended up eating there twice as we had to experience it again (mostly for the view) on the last evening. Also, the staff was excellent and the hotel has fast wifi available without charge. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...with the luxury and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rj46
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location coupled with caring staff and a very spacious room. Our one year old also had a great time as he was treated like a sultan in the city of sultans. Excellent balcony and rooftop views of the sea and the surronding historic buildings. Recommend higly.

Reviews.Title: “Delight in heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Rotor1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at this hotel en route to Ankara. The location could not be better for a short stay, close to the Grand Bazzar, Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. They are all within very easy walking distance, as are a wide variety of restaurants. The staff at this hotel are a delight and nothing is too much trouble. Indeed, as we had an early flight on our day of departure, they arranged a very early breakfast for us - suggesting that we took it on the roof terrace for a 'last look at Istanbul'. The roof terrace must have the best view of the city - looking out on the two mosques, the Bosphorus and a roofscape of the old town. The food there is wonderful too. We had a basic room, although they were keen for us to move, the next day, to a bigger and better appointed room so that we would enjoy our stay better (no extra charge!). Beautifully equipped, although a little small, we decided not to bother with a move - we were perfectly comfortable where we were. We had a glorious stay in Istanbul, not nearly long enough but absolutely magical - not the least because of the staff and the ambience of this little gem of a hotel. Go there - you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: pbfr
Reviews.Content: In addition to the perfect lacation next to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and other attractions, the Seven Hills Hotel staff is accomodationg, friendly and helpful. The hotel manager in particular makes every effort to ensure that your stay in Istanbul is all that you could ever want. The rooms are clean and spacious. You don't want to miss going up to the roof garden at night to see the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia lit up. The area is safe and definitely the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “best Hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: malayar
Reviews.Content: we stayed in seven hills for seven days .the service was Excellent. room was with great view and location is middle of old city waking distance from Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful start to a wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: susi12866
Reviews.Content: Located between Haggia Sophia and the Blue Mosque this small hotel is perfectly located. Our room was comfortable and nicely appointed. After hours of exploring Istanbul it was lovely to "come home" for a cat nap, a soak in the large tub and a glass of apple tea! The staff at Seven Hills is superb. They began taking care of us before we arrived, arranging transportation from the airport to the hotel. ( And didn't stop until the moment we left Istanbul!) The owner, Ismail, is ever present, checking always to see that you are satisfied with your stay at the hotel. Beyond that he took a personal interest that we got to where we wanted. Bus or tram routes were advised , cabs were called, dinner reservations made. It was quite remarkable. There is a restaurant/bar on the fourth floor with a terrace above. The food was excellent. The breakfast buffet plentiful and tasty. Fresh fruit, yogurt, bread and rolls, cheese, cucumbers, tomatoes , olives, halva and more. And for those who can't live without coca puffs, well not to worry! Everyone speaks English and all are happy to assist you in building your Turkish vocabulary if you want. With luck Seckin, clerk, concierge and generally knowledgeable young man, will be on duty. Between Ismail and Seckin and the other attentive staff you will find a warm reception and a special experience to enhance your visit. Ours was magical! SR

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have stayed at a better place.”
Reviews.Author: Guidoflyer
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills Hotel is perfectly located, near all the Sultanhamet sights. It's right across from the 4 Seasons, yet is 1/4 the price. The staff is incredibly nice. They are genuine, and truly helpful. The rooftop terrace has the BEST view of Sultanahmet Square, bar none, but be prepared to pay for the privilege. Rooms are nice sized, recently refurbished, with lots of water pressure, nice and hot.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and location”
Reviews.Author: cloverdc
Reviews.Content: Some people think being nice is over-rated, but not me - especially when it comes to hotel staff. The folks here at Seven Hills are incredibly kind, thoughtful, helpful, etc. One gentleman stayed after 11 pm to help me buy a ticket for the ferry; the others were more than happy to give us directions or make other accomodations we needed. The breakfasts were very good - lots of food to choose from. The rooms were quite nice, too. A great location - right in the heart of it all. I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jackyie
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 great days in Istanbul at Seven Hills Hotel. All stuff was so kindly and so helpful, always smiling and having attention to us. The view on the roof is wonderful I couln't say how much. Breakfast was also very nice with a lot of choice (fruits, cheese, sausages, potatoes, yogurt and so on). I was together with my daughter, so we booked for a double room and the gave us a triple room (double bed and single), that was great. What I liked the best was the service, the staff and the view on the roof. Maybe the prices of the restaurants are a too expensive. I didn't try it because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and service”
Reviews.Author: history_travelerUsa
Reviews.Content: We just returned from eight days in Istanbul, where we stayed at the Seven Hills Hotel in the Sultanahmet neighborhood. The hotel enhanced our visit to the city in several ways. First, the location can't be beat: we were witihin a few minutes walk to the top destinations, including Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia, and surrounded by shops and restaurants. Second, the hotel's excellent restaurant offered one of the best views in the city in its top floor location, with breathtaking views of the two great mosques and the Sea of Marmara. Eating breakfast with these views every morning was a fine way to start the day. And third, but not least, the hotel staff had one of the highest customer service ethics we've experienced anywhere. We would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone considering a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: devotioncafe
Reviews.Content: We had the luxury of staying at Seven Hills Istanbul for 4 nights from May 12-May 16. It has a perfect location in Sultanahmet right next to the Four Season's Hotel, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. Everything was perfect. The rooms large and airy, the service was excellent as everyone was there for us at all times. It was definitely one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. Do not expect a grand commercial hotel as this was a boutique style hotel with all the amenities of a large star chain. Also the rooftop Restaurant/Bar has the most amazing view you could possibly imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pilgrim_9
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay immensely. The staff is wonderful and the location is unmatched.

Reviews.Title: “Better than most hotels that are 2-3 times the price.”
Reviews.Author: HConley
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because my previous favorite hotel in Istanbul was booked. I chose the 7 Hills from reviews at various websites. I travel a great deal, & I can honestly say I'd rather stay here than at the Four Seasons across the street (which costs many times more). The rooms are quiet, clean, comfortable & spacious. Excellent bath/hot water, strong wireless connection, quality bedding, etc. The staff went out of their way to make us feel like royalty. I doubt I'll ever stay anywhere else in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “friendliness, efficiency and wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: jeanfried
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, especially Seckin, always available and resourceful. Great location and very beautiful restaurant. Quite good too and a great view on Haja Sofia and Blue Mosque and also the sea of Marmara Comfortable but rooms a little small; compensated by the terrace. Good wifi. Clearly we will come back Professor Jean Fried

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Firewatr
Reviews.Content: Seven Hill Hotel is like going away on vacation to a loving family. The hotel has a phenomenal location looking out at Aya Sophia and The Blue Mosque. You never need a taxi to anything!! Restaurants surround the hotel, the shopping is incredible- the Grand Bazzar, Spice Markets are all within walking distance. And the breakfast included - lunches and dinners at the hotel-in summer months- one needs a reservation. The view of the Bosphorous from their rooftop is mesmerizing. The rooms are extremely comfortable-very tastefully decorated!! A travel agent is available through the hotel- she made our itinerary and reservations in one day for a trip to Pammulkle- we had our own guide there -he was extremely informative and knowledgeable-the Ninth Wonder of the World!! Leaving Istanbul, a customs agent in front of us was questioning a Brit who had taken up residency in Turkey-the Brit responded" the people, the food, the weather-why wouldn't I want to live here!!!" We are coming back to Turkey ASAP- there is so much more to explore!!! And the shopping is unequalled!! Lovely people become friends for life!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, great location and a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Tim_Germany
Reviews.Content: As a matter of fact, we chose this hotel by chance only because of its location. When we arrived, we learned that we made a right decision: The location was even better than expected, the room was spacious and clean and the staff delivered a warm welcome. During our stay we appreciated above all the friendliness of all people we met - it was not just the staff of our hotel, but everybody in the surrounding streets: You were greeted and smiled at by everyone. Naturally, the terrasse is worth a description: There is a beautiful view over Istanbul, in the middle of Ayasofia and Sultanahmet Camii (Blue Mosque). While having breakfast you can experience the awaking of the city! All in all - Istanbul is definetly the right place to go, and the Seven Hills is definetly the right place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Jipsi79
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this hotel. Great service and friendly staff. Did not have the time to try out the restaurant, this will have to be on the next stay. The beds were a bit hard, according to Norwegian standard (",) I guess other guests from Scandinavia will think the same.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, location, and people”
Reviews.Author: Steve4721
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for our stay in Istanbul! We were shown three rooms on the third and fourth floors and each looked great in terms of it's cleaniness, modern upgrades, and furniture. Each room had expansive views from huge windows. We chose room 403 (on the top floor) that had a full view of the Aya Sofia and the Bosphorus. The hotel's location could not have been better and it was really useful to have free wireless throughout the hotel. The most memorable part of our stay was the warm welcome and helpfulness of all of the staff. In particular, Seckin and one of the hotel owners, Ishmael (sp?) seemed to always be there and were always eager to make us feel welcome and be helpful for our stay. We thoroughly enjoyed our conversations with them.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectation”
Reviews.Author: PGFD
Reviews.Content: From first contact to departure friendly and helpful reception, chamber maid, restaurant staff as well as the manager and owner in this very well located hotel made our (Pensioner parents + daughters a. 21 and 19) stay a pleasure. Hotel's recommended guide was both informative and entertaining also hotel's carpet shop and proposed tours were enjoyable and their airpoirt transfer service good value. Istanbul is no longer cheap for direct booking so via a tour operator, if possible, will improve value; beware wine prices are absurd. However Turkish people and plethora of amazing buildings combined with Seven Hills warmth to give us a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: AAA07
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the Seven Hills hotel with my parents and sister. We live in Turkey, but needed a good place to stay in Istanbul close to the attractions. A number of friends suggested the Seven Hills because of its wonderful staff, great location (adjacent to Topkapi palace and Aya Sofia), and unrivaled views of the Sultanahmet area. We were definitely not disappointed. We would suggest this hotel to friends visiting Istanbul for the first time, or to frequent visitors that wanted to stay in Sultanahmet, versus the busy areas in and around Beyoglu.

Reviews.Title: “We finded the location very enjoyable in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: travelerTehran
Reviews.Content: As I mentioned the location of the hotel wasw perfect and the view was romantic.We were highly received by the hotel staff and they were very kind indeed. I also loved the perfect view from its balconi on the fifth and sixth floot with its veiw towards the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amazing customer service, we wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: BigErnz
Reviews.Content: We live in Ankara, and have traveled to Istanbul three times in the past six months, staying at three different hotels. Of the places we've stayed, the Seven Hills provided the best customer service hands down. We tried a couple of other places as they looked cheaper, but we ended up coming back to the Seven Hills because the location is unbeatable, and the staff there is so accommodating and friendly, it's not worth it to us to stay anywhere else. The Aya Sofia, Topkapi palace, and the Blue Mosque are all less than five minutes' walk away, the Grand Bazaar is 15 minutes by foot, and there are tons of great restaurants just minutes away. The second time we stayed there, with my husband's parents, they gave us an amazing rate on the two best rooms in the hotel. The view from the Saint Sophia suite is absolutely breathtaking! My husband, our son and I stayed in the Presidential Suite, which was great as it provided plenty of room for our little boy to crawl around on the floor (a rare commodity in a hotel room in Sultanahmet). I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “I felt very much at home”
Reviews.Author: AlanWilsonNewZealand
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked in Seckin made me feel very welcome. The room was great, the location fantastic and the service was brilliant. The restaurant is one of the best ones in the area and the food is delicious. Ive stayed at several different hotels in Istanbul and there was always something lacking with each of them. Now, I believe that I have found the one hotel that I will stay at every time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location, amazing service and very clean”
Reviews.Author: pwcasey
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the 7Hills Hotel for 3 nights. I enjoyed every minute of my stay. The hotel is located as close as you can get to the main tourist attractions (Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque). The wonderful rooftop restaurant serves not only a great breakfast but amazing 360 degree views of Istanbul. The rooms are clean, and the two different rooms I had came with very nice views. The hotel staff is top notch! They were very helpful with touristy suggestions, as well as arranging transportation to the airport and around the city. Overall, my Istanbul experience would not have been the same if I had not stayed at the 7 hills. I highly recommend it to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “The Seven Hills Hotel is the best hotel I have been to”
Reviews.Author: MinkoMM
Reviews.Content: I have been to numerous hotels in Europe (Austria, UK, Germany, Italy, Greece) and Canada, my wife has been to many more hotels in Belgium and France, and we agree that in terms of the service provided, the Seven Hills Hotel is without doubt the best hotel we have visited. From the very moment we arrived right until we said the final "Good bye!" to the concierge we were positive we could rely 100% on the hotel staff about everything. For instance, the main goal of our trip to Istanbul was to see the cello concert of Julian Lloyd Webber, which took place on 28.02.2009. We had very little experience with Turkey and Istanbul and so the concierge arranged our transport to the concert hall and back, he gave us all the warnings of what to do and what to avoid with Istanbul taxis and his concern about our well-being was genuine and very touching. Our room was gorgeous with splendid view of the huge Saint Sofia church. The room was perfectly clean, decorated with taste and quite spacious. The wireless Net worked fine. The location of the hotel is fantastic, it is right in the most interesting part of Istanbul between Saint Sophia and the Blue Mosque (see the photos attached). The hotel's restaurant is on the top of the building and that happens to be the highest spot in the vicinity, so if you go to the terrace on top of the restaurant you have a 360-degree view! This is not to be missed! -- just by turning your head around, you can rest your eyes on the Marmara see or the Prince Islands or the Asian bank of the Bosphorus or Sain Sophia or the Blue Mosque. Of course, in February it is a bit cold to have a dinner outside but I can't wait to go there in the summer! What my wife and myself liked most is first of all, the great service of this hotel - very gentle, very helpful, with genuine concern for the guests' well-being. Then we liked the hotel itself, it is tasteful, cozy and perfectly clean and quiet. Then we liked the food - the restaurant on the top I mentioned prepares the best food in Istanbul, as far as we can tell from a four-day visit. We tried several other restaurants just for the diversity but they were not as good. The friendliness of the personnel is noticeable in the restaurant, too: my wife made several requests for food items and beverages that were not in the menu but could easily be prepared (like lemonade made according to her taste) and they were fulfilled perfectly. I would like to thank in person Seckin Keles, the concierge who made every minute of our stay in the Seven Hills Hotel a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, will recommend to every Istanbul visitor!!”
Reviews.Author: prtslv
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon in Turkey. We spent in Istanbul with 4 nights in Seven Hills and 1 night in the Blue House (both in Sultanahmet) and let me tell you the service and staff and location at Seven Hills is way beyond expectations, so much so that we sorely disappointed with the Blue House (we checked out a day early from there and regretted ever staying there). Both Sechik and Benjamin went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. We were always made to feel that we were the only people staying there and that we were family. The breakfast was great and so was the staff at the restaurant. Last, but not the least, the views were absolutely incredible. I would totally recommend everyone going to Istanbul to stay at the Seven Hills for comfortable and delightful experience. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a guest in a friend's home”
Reviews.Author: WeMakeTravelEasycom
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I was on a research trip to Turkey. The Seven Hills was recommended to me by an friend living in Turkey. The hotel was wonderful. It is located across the street from the Four Seasons and at a fraction of the price. It is a very short walk to all the major sites, yet the neighborhood is quiet and charming. It is 18 rooms in an old Ottoman house. The restaurant (where your breakfast is served, is on the roof. You have a fabulous view of Istanbul and the water). The rooms are large, the furnishing are more like what you would find in a home rather than a hotel. The rooms have individual safes, a mini refrigerator and bottled water. The most wonderful thing about this hotel is the staff. Everyone from the front desk to housekeeping is friendly and goes out of their way to be sure your needs are met and your stay is comfortable. The general manager of the hotel will give you personal service and arrange tours, guides, transportaion, restaurant recommendations etc. He provides the equivalent of a concierge service. One doesn't typically have concierge service in a small property. I felt like I was staying with friends in their home, yet I had all the service of a hotel. I think it really enhanced my experience in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “"Memorable Experience"”
Reviews.Author: JaynieNYC
Reviews.Content: We contacted the Seven Hills hotel with a few others in Istanbul and Bulant the manager was the first to reply back. The other hotels with good reviews still hadnt responded even a week later. We booked this trip months in advance ut he made us feel like we were a priority just as if we were standing right there in front of him. He helped us figure out the best room for us and even gave us tour options so far in advance so we were really able to look forward to the trip. The service before we arrived and while in the hotel was always prompt, friendly and all staff left us with a pleasant warm smile. If you are looking for service in a boutique hotel with the best views at breakfast this is your best option. We were in Istanbul for 4 days before leaving on a cruise with Regent and I can't imagine being happier at another hotel. If stuffy large hotels are your preference for your visit to Istanbul--save the seven hills hotel for people who want to get a taste of the surroundings without sacrificing comfort. Location was perfect---close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “A Genuine Delight”
Reviews.Author: LAsuggests
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a delight. The staff is great, the location ideal, and the view is fantastic. You will be very glad you stayed at Seven Hills! The price is reasonable, and the food is very good as well. All in all, it is a good value and simply a nice place to stay for a day or a month in the heart of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kinmb
Reviews.Content: I, my daughter and my niece stayed at this hotel for 2 days at the start of our trip and 3 days at the end. This is such a boutique hotel with ever smiling and helpful staff (especially Benjamin), we were so sad when we left. The rooms were absolutely clean, beds were excellent, bathrooms spic and span. The roof top restaurant is devine, looks down on the 5 star Four season hotel across the street. We arrived at mid night and Benjamin took his time at that time of the night to show us all the facilities took us to the roof top restaurant, pointed us the neighboring attractions from there and even gave us a drink of Raki (the famous Turkish liquor) . We felt so good at his warmth and friendliness. I cannot think of anything that I did not like (except for the high price but Turkey has become very expensive now because of the Euro economy). The breakfast was not great but adequate. The roof top restaurant offers excellent views of Bosphorous, Blue Mosque, and Hajia Sophia. But the food is very pricy and not that great. We tried several restaurants in the neighborhood but we were not really happy with any of them except one restaurant calle OZ, which is couple of streets away (Akbayik Cad, No 24). The food there was very good and they even gave us complimentary after dinner drinks. Recommendations: Safe deposit box in the rooms. The area is generally safe but you never know. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Seven Hills Hotel in Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: chhardy
Reviews.Content: On my recent trip to Turkey, I had stayed with my tour for two days at the Ritz-Carlton in the new district. Once traveling alone, I not only wanted a well-located hotel in the old city for my last two days but I also wanted something less per night than the Ritz. I had been told of the Seven Hills Hotel as being in the middle of Sultanahmet & made my reservation online. Bulent, the manager, as well as the rest of the staff were wonderful to work with & to get to know. Very nice people & very diligent to make one's stay pleasant. My room was quite spacious with an outside balcony. I was traveling with my laptop so having free WiFi in my room was great. The Seven Hills is located across the street from the Four Seasons & also has an impressive rooftop restaurant which, especially at sunset, shows off an amazing view of the Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia. From the hotel, I was able to easily walk everywhere. I also could have just as easily taken the nearby city tram across town. Istanbul is a fantastic city & The Seven Hills Hotel contributed to my enjoyable time there.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, excellent service, great food”
Reviews.Author: OsloViking
Reviews.Content: This hotel has maybe the best location in all of Istanbul. Right between Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque overlooking the Marmara sea. The roof top restaurant is the highest in this area packed with small hotels, you are really king of the hill up there (looking down on the luxurious hotel next door). The restaurant serves excellent turkish food, wide selection of fish, seafood, meat and meze. Service was extremely helpful and friendly. Personnel speaks english. Area is peaceful despite the denisty of hotels and restaurants. Hotel itself is clean and well kept, although the rooms are somewhat overdone in colours and decoration by my taste. Spacious and comfortable beds. Building exterior is classical ottoman style wood. Not the cheapest hotel, but good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bkirsch
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It's a good mid range hotel right near everything. The staff were really, really great and helpful. There was a mix up with my room (travel website's fault, not theirs) and they upgraded me from a single to a suite with sweeping views of the Bosporus and Hagia Sophia. And they made sure everything was nice. I was not up sold much on tours, though I did buy a couple. And the location can't be beat as well as the view from the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1940
Reviews.Content: We were recommended this hotel by Turkish friends, and it was great. Perfect location across the street from the delux Four Seasons, so we could look into their gardens with no cost! Our room was spacious, with a decor more in line with Turkish taste for color, but not Hiltonesque. The roof top terrace had a view that was perfection, looking out on the Bosporus, Aga Sophia, and the Blue Mosque, each just a stroll away. We especially like their fish grill restaurant, much better than the dinner we had at Four Seasons or other restaurants listed in Fodor's. The star is Bulent, the front desk manager. In his email he had welcomed us to the family, and when we arrived it felt just like that. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “THE ONLY PLACE TO STAY AT IN ISTANBUL”
Reviews.Author: Lubis
Reviews.Content: I brought along with me a group of 25 people for Istanbul tour. While browsing for hotels, i contacted MANY hotels but Seven Hills Hotel was the one who was MOST PROFESSIONAL, MOST FRIENDLY, MOST HELPFUL, and HAS GREAT COMMUNICATION. So we booked our hotel including tour package through the handy hotel manager. And, since we landed all through our tour, we were satisfied with the service. The manager would go through all lengths to ensure we had what we expected and more. Thank you Bulent =) The hotel was fabulous. We loved the strategic location by Sultanahmet and the rooms was to our high standards. All 25 of us loved the hotel and would definitely use Hotel Seven Hills again for our future trips to Istanbul. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Experience”
Reviews.Author: CasperVienna
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end this was a fabulous experience! I made a last minute decision to try to go to Istanbul over the Easter weekend. Unfortunately the last minute part was a problem as there was no room at ANY of the inns I inquired of. However, the manager of Seven Hills didn't give up until he found a way to make my stay possible. But that was just the beginning. He met me the day after I arrived and helped me plan my entire stay--making suggestions and booking arrangements. He also steered me in the right direction for the serious shopping I wanted to do. From tours to restaurants to shops, the suggestions were first rate and the service in arranging it all was impeccable. I was sad to leave as I felt like I had made a new friend. But I'm already planning my next trip to visit "an old friend."

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN SULTANAHMET”
Reviews.Author: Geotraveler_8
Reviews.Content: My friend and I have just returned from a terrific visit to Istanbul. Luckily, we stayed at the Seven Hills Hotel which is located in the historic district. From our bedroom (designated the Presidential Suite) we could see the Haghia Sophia in one direction and the Blue Mosque in another. Both of these beautiful and historically significant buildings were only a short walk from the hotel. And, the Topaki Palace is just a few steps beyond. If we had visited in warmer months we could have enjoyed these sights while sitting on our private balcony. Our room was large and simply furnished, with a king size bed and a sofa that served as an additional bed. The bathroom was large and we had plenty of fresh towels. The furniture was a bit shabby, but the friendly and extremely helpful staff made up for any shortcomings in the furnishing. We really felt like famly in this small hotel, and could not have had better service. There is an excellent roof top restaurant that includes a view of the Bosphorus as well as the magnificent Mosques. While enjoying a good breakfast we could watch international shipping as well as the many ferries and small fishing boats. We enjoyed two dinners at the restaurant which specializes in very fresh fish, that was well prepared. The hotel manager arranged for very good guides, a boat trip and restaurant reservations as well as very efficient airport transport. Our first trip to Istanbul was a great experience especially because of the perfect location and always helpful staff of this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: travelbluey
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good in every respect....great location in the heart of Sultanahmet, amazing views from the rooftop restaurant.....where they serve the breakfast. The staff is very helpful and looks after all your requests. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Turkey”
Reviews.Author: BitSechelt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really nice and overlooks the Four Seasons Hotel and Blue Mosque and Sophia. It is a lovely place with restaurant on the roof. The Manager and staff are very accomidating down to the finest detail. Helped us book tours, gave us directions to get to different places. Arranged pick-up and return to Airport. We would reccommend this hotel to anyone wanting to visit Instanbul Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Seven Hills Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: just4fun2
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful experiences while staying at this hotel!! Although it was not considered by the travel companies to be a 5-star hotel, we were treated with 5-star service. Bulent Sayan, the Manager, made sure that everything was taken care of in advance. When we entered the hotel, it was bright and sunny, with dark wood and Turkish art, it was absolutely charming. The young man, Jabriel, who was manning the reception desk was busy with another client, but he took the time to look up at us and smile. (What a huge difference from other experiences we have had in past travels around Europe.) As soon as we mentioned our name to him he told us that Bulent had mentioned us, and the next thing we knew there was a man standing by the elevator with our luggage waiting to help us. We were shown to our room which was beautifully decorated in traditional Turkish style, it was very clean and comfortable, with a deep European style bathtub, and lots of hot water. I loved that there was more than adequate storage for our things, and the fact that we were also able to open our windows to see the locals, smell the local cuisine (divine), and hear all the wonderful sounds of Istanbul, made the beginning of our trip exciting. But there is more to come...on the roof top is an amazing restaurant. They serve the freshest fish I believe I have ever eaten, and there is a large variety of dishes on the menu to choose from, so it makes it difficult. We had reservations about six in the evening just as the sun was going down, and it didn't dawn on me until we were up there how fortunate we were to be in this specific hotel. The location of the Seven Hills is directly in-between the Blue Mosque, and the Haija Sophia, two of the most amazing archetectural structures in the world!!. What ambience!! Can you imagine....on the roof with your sweetie, sun going down, stars twinkling, traditional Turkish music playing, the freshest food, the best service...wow, it doesn't get any better. Between the service, the food and the view I have never had better memories. The few days that we were there Bulent and his staff treated us like family. They took care of us in a way that I have never experienced in any of my travels, and it is the only place I have ever been where I was sorry that I had to leave. I am certain that it was because of the wonderful treatment that we received by Bulent, Jabriel, and the rest of the staff at the Seven Hills hotel. When we go back, and, we will, this is where we will stay. I miss them already.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Hills is the best”
Reviews.Author: mkrause
Reviews.Content: My friends and I spent a whole week at the Seven Hills and had a magnificent time. We had a suite with a view of the Aya Sofia and everything was top rate - accomodation, service, attention, comfort, cleanliness and location. Taxi cab service right around the corner, lots of walkable restaurants/shops/hamams nearby, even though we found ourselves spending every evening on the rooftop which is the highest point in the neighborhood providing 360 view of Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and the Bosphorus. The whole staff was not only attentive but friendly. The Seven Hills is not just a hotel, it was home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cprogler
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Istanbul at 6 am, and I was greeted by a friendly driver hired by the hotel who assisted me immediately. When we arrived my room was naturally not ready for such an early check in, but I was invited to an early breakfast on the rooftop and completely forgot about checking into my room once I went up there. Imagine seeing the sun come up over the entire city, with the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque glowing, while having a cup of coffee. I was entranced by the city's beauty, but impressed at the 360 degree view of Istanbul from the rooftop of Seven Hills Hotel -higher than the rooftop of the Four Seasons just across the street. My room was just perfect, spacious and clean, with a warm personality that made it feel like home during my stay. Throughout my five days and nights at the hotel, the staff was always polite and helpful, providing services including laundry (very affordable), tourism advice, and excellent food and service in the rooftop restaurant. You can watch the sun rise or set on the rooftop, while having a delicious and affordable meal, and never have to leave your hotel if you'd just like to relax and take in the beauty of this ancient city-all from the Seven Hills Hotel. I will definitely stay at this hotel during my future visits to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: SwiftTraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first trip to Istanbul, and the hotel and its staff couldn't have been better. The rooms were comfortable, clean, and well-maintained (this coming from someone who would much rather have booked the Four Seasons but was happily surprised at the bang for your buck at Seven Hills), and the staff was great at recommending restaurants, sights, calling taxis, etc. We did not eat at the rooftop restaurant, but it's a fantastic place for drinks and has wonderful views. Also, the location can't be beat--spitting distance from the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, and Hagia Sophia. Just one recommendation--don't be talked into the paid tours. Everything, including the Bosphorus tour, can easily be done on your own for much less money. Istanbul is an easily navigated city and is friendly to foreigners.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated; great hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: SaraMiddleofSweden
Reviews.Content: This nice hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of Sultanahmet. Sultanahmet is the 'old town' of Istanbul. It is a friendly and non-criminal area. We were here with our children, and it felt perfecly safe to walk arround in this area during day as well as nigth. The hotel is situated in a calm and nice neighborhood with all the main attractions within only some minutes walking distance. We spent three days here, and easily manage to see all the main attractions since they were so close to the hotel. For instance, you can see one attraction in the morning, return to the hotel for a short rest, and then go out again. Perfect! The hotel also has a very nice top roof restaurant where you have an extraordinary view of the Blue Mosque and Hagya Sofia. There are several other nice restaurants in the neighborhood as well. The staff speaks good English and is very nice and helpful. The hotel can arrange pick-up service at the airport, and the hotel can also arrange different trips. We went on a half-day trip on the Bosporus, very nice. I really recommend this hotel! Next time in Istanbul; I will try to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - A Dream View”
Reviews.Author: Nard14
Reviews.Content: When they say location is everything, they had the Seven Hills Hotel in Istanbul Turkey in mind. It was right where you want to be in the old town, walking distance to key sites there. Also, right near the tram line. Rooftop restaurant overlooking the Blue Mosque has a spectacular view! It is a boutique, family owned hotel that tries to make each guest's stay a special one as only Turkish hospitality can achieve. Price was quite reasonable for the value received. Service at the hotel and in its rooftop restaurant overlooking the city was excellent. Same owner has a travel agency a block away that helped us immediately arrange a couple of unique tours along the lines of "when the tourists turn left, we want to turn right." All in all, quite a positive experience at the Seven Hills.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the hotel very much”
Reviews.Author: realtorseena
Reviews.Content: we just got back from our stay at the seven hills hotel. the room i expected was not available so we had another room which was very nice and the price was adjusted without my even asking it to be done. the staff is excellent. they were very helpful and made several phone calls for me. the roof top resturant is just beautiful with an amazing view of the city and outstanding food. the location is outstanding since you can walk to everything. it is located opposite the four seasons which we did not recognize because it is totally non descript until you walk in side.

Reviews.Title: “Very unsatisfied!!”
Reviews.Author: DistantFrank
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite (the Saint Sophia suite) at the Seven Hills Hotel months in advance. When we arrived, they told us the hotel was overbooked, that our suite was no longer available, and that they were moving us to their sister hotel (the Blue Hills) that was just down the street, in a room that had a gorgeous water view. This next hotel, although only about 8 blocks down the street, was in a far worse neighborhood. The room had no working telephone. The so-called gorgeous view you could barely see out of one window. In fact, the main view we had was of dilapidated buildings and a huge garbage heap that was piled across the street. And there was so much noise outside all night, perhaps because a bar was just nearby. We could not believe that we had booked what we believed to be a gorgeous room in a very nice hotel, and then they pulled a fast one on us and shoved us in a crappy place. What could we do??? Not much at the time. But now we can warn potential customers about how this place runs a bad business. Seven Hills Hotel: NOT RECOMMENDED. Find another place. Believe me. You will not regret it. Who cares what the pictures show online for the Seven Hills. You won't get the room anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Introduction to Turkey”
Reviews.Author: eyemaker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 2-week trip to Turkey, highlighted by a great 2-night stay at Seven Hills Hotel. This was a trip we had originally started to plan over two years ago so we could be on the Turkish Mediterranean coast for the March 2006 total solar eciplse. Unfortunately my elderly mother got sick and ultimately died just 2 weeks before our scheduled departure, so we had to cancel everything. I was determined to reschedule this year--all but the eclipse. So our tour really got off to a wonderful start when we finally arrived at our hotel in Istanbul. I had been communicating with the manager, Bulent, for almost two years, about this trip, and he had really gone way beyond the expected in promptly responding to emails, graciously accepting the last-minute cancellation, and then helping me find an excellent Istanbul travel agent. I felt terrible when I cancelled the first trip, so was delighted to finally be there and meet Bulent. The hotel itself could not be in a better location in the old part of Istanbul, Sultanahmet. The hotel is a beautiful wooden structure of the old Istanbul style, several stories high, with a restaurant on the roof that has an incredible 360-degree view of the Bosphorus, the Blue Mosque, Aya Sophia, and Topkapi Palace, and all of Istanbul. This is where the breakfast is served, and it was breathtaking to see the early morning sun illuminating everything. The hotel is simple but elegant and uses a lot of nice antiques. Nothing overly ornate, but the entire ambience was one of gracious Turkish hospitality. My husband and I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone seeking to stay in this section of istanbul and doesn't want to spend a fortune. We feel we got outstanding service, and this was for only a 2-night stay. In other words, the management had no particular reason to have been so helpful to us, certainly not huge profits, but they did it anyway. Thanks, Seven Hills.

Reviews.Title: “great location, brilliant terrace, but reserved room not available”
Reviews.Author: Gree
Reviews.Content: As a special treat we had booked 5 nights in one of the special suites: my husband has been unwell, and we wanted to be sure of comfort and quality. The warm and friendly correspondence from the hotel seemed to assure us of both. On arrival at the hotel, however, we were coolly informed that the suite was available only from the NEXT night, and that we would have to stay in a 'nice double room' for the first night. Protests, including producing printouts of the confirmation, fruitless! The substitute double room turned out to be very average indeed - not a good start to our stay. A one-off unfortunate error? We hoped so - until another guest told us that she had booked a suite as a birthday treat, and had also discovered on arrival that it was not available for the first night. Great things about the Seven Hills? The terrace is wonderful - highest point in Sultanahmet, with stunning views of the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofia. The bar and restaurant staff are delightful. Overall, though, we were disappointed and have since experienced a couple of far better accommodation options. Seven Hills is not a cheap hotel, and it clearly wants to be a lovely one - but its ability to deliver falls short of its location and its ambitions.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend Seven Hills”
Reviews.Author: TorontoSooz
Reviews.Content: We recently capped off an anniversary trip through Greece and Turkey with a visit to Istanbul. While there we stayed at the Seven Hills Hotel which proved to be an experience of a lifetime. We were picked up at the airport and taken to the hotel which is within walking distance of The Blue Mosque, Topkai Palace, Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market. We began our visit with a visit to the rooftop where the views of Istanbul are second to none. Our accommodation was beautiful, clean and comfortable. The staff couldn't have been nicer and the General Manager Bulent did everything to ensure our stay would be memorable - we have never before been personally escorted around a city by the General Manager of our hotel. Seven Hills is not to be missed! I know we will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “The Jewel of our trip”
Reviews.Author: crazy_canuckToronto
Reviews.Content: Last September, we embarked on a lovely trip of the Greek Islands and parts of Turkey in celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary. The Seven Hills Hotel was to be our treat at the end of this lovely vacation. The General Manager of Seven Hills, Bulent, clearly went above and beyond the call of duty. Once we had checked in, he invited us to the rooftop lounge and began our visit with a detailed conversation to discover what we would like to get out of our Istanbul experience. Once armed with this information he made a number of suggestions of things to do and see during our stay in Istanbul. From his selection of a guide to take us on a historic walking tour, to his personal tutelage in negotiating with shopkeepers in the Grand Bazaar his recommendations were flawless and his personal assistance was unparalleled. The staff at the Seven Hills was equally committed to the best overall experience for their guests. This hotel is small and intimate and while there, we felt like we were part of the family. They were consistently attentive whether servicing a request for our room, or suddenly appearing with a beautiful woven shawl to ward off the autumn evening breeze on the rooftop. Our suite, The Marmora, was gorgeous in its extravagant fabrics and detail. The views were breathtaking; either experienced from our room, or the hotelâ€™s excellent rooftop restaurant. There is no better location in Istanbul to enjoy the views of the many historic sites including the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque or the endless ships on the Sea of Marmora entering and exiting the Bosphorus. Seven Hills was indeed the jewel that capped a most memorable holiday for us.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Seven Hills and will be back!”
Reviews.Author: TammyfromMiami
Reviews.Content: I met the owner of the Seven Hills Hotel while on a business trip to Istanbul in 2004. Although I was staying at another hotel, the owner invited me to see the Seven Hills. I loved the location and the awesome view from the terrace, so I decided right then and there to stay at this hotel when I returned to Istanbul. In November 2006, I finally got my opportunity! I contacted the Seven Hills via the internet and was pleasantly surprised to get a warm welcome message from Bulent, the general manager. Bulent assisted me with reservations for myself and three colleagues. My room was on the second floor. It was completely comfortable and functional. I especially enjoyed having a drink in the restaurant and enjoying the the terrific view from the terrace. Every morning, we were treated to a great buffet and eggs cooked to order! The location of this hotel is great and the rate was reasonable, but what sets this hotel apart from other hotels is the warm, friendly and excellent staff. led by Bulent! I really felt at home and appreciated their kindness and helpfulness. Many thanks to Bulent and all of the staff at the Seven Hills! I will definitely stay at the Seven Hills again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Wonderful Service!”
Reviews.Author: sykang72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seven Hills for 6 days in December and enjoyed it very much. After reviewing trip advisor in order to select a hotel in Istanbul, Seven Hills Hotel seemed to be the best choice with it's perfect location, personalized service, and beautiful rooms. I contacted the hotel directly and got a lot of help even before my actual stay. As I was planning to visit other parts of Turkey, Bullent (the GM) recommended Turkland Travel Agency. I was able to plan my trip to Ephesus/Pamukkale/Cappadocia in advance through Turkland at a reasonable price with excellent service, which made me very happy. (I was very satisfied with the arranged hotels/guide/transporation ) Before and after my side excursion, I stayed in a corner suite on the 3rd and 1st floor that was spacious and comfortable with an awesome view. The 3rd floor corner suite had a huge terrace where you could see an un-obstructive view of Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. It was great to take photos! The room had nice wooden floors with luxurious decor. The bed was nice and firm. The bathroom was clean and large and had a jacuzzi that I relaxed in after the long sightseeing trips of Istanbul. The breakfast was well prepared every morning, buffet style. It offered a variety of bread, fruit, cheese, eggs, yogurt, cereal, olives, vegetables, etc and all kinds of juices, milk, water, tea, coffee etc. The gentleman serving breakfast even made an omelet if you requested. The view from the restaurant terrace was fabulous, probably the best in Istanbul. The location was just perfect, within 10 minute walking distance to major tourist attractions such as Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Topaki Palace, etc. And a taxi stand was just around the corner if you needed to catch a taxi. Many quaint restaurants and cafes were in the neighborhood as well. And all staff were very friendly and caring. Bullent went out of his way to recommend and arrange a belly dance dinner show that was fun, and recommended other nice restaurants that I really enjoyed. He also upgraded me to the corner suite during my stay which I cannot thank him enough! And there were also so many other little perks that he offered which enriched my experience in Turkey. The other staff were always smiling and helful and treated me like family. As this hotel is a small boutique hotel, I received personalized intimate service, by far the best service compared to all the other places I visited around the world! I would definitely stay at the Seven Hills again next time in Turkey and would recommend it to all my friends. Thanks again for the memorable experience!!! Because of Seven Hills, Turkey will remain a special country in my heart :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & hospitality”
Reviews.Author: kiyomi
Reviews.Content: Location: The location is the best amongst the boutique hotels nearby. The roof top restaurant for breakfast will provide you with the energy to start off the day :). The food there is also very good. Room: Stayed at Bue Mosque Double - it was just worthwhile spending the rate. (Stayed just 1 night at the other hotel as Seven Hills was fully booked slightly cheaper, but extra EUR for Seven Hills deserves much much more!!!) One remark though on that room. The room is located on the floor where people get off the lift and use stairs to go to the restaurant, and inventory room. You keep hearing the footsteps of other guests and the staffs during the morning & daytime hours... although you wont hear them in the evening hrs. Hospitality: The concierge/receptionist has been in the close touch with all the email correspondences before the stay (I normally receive his response in 24hrs). They have also supported me during my stay. It's not too much, but just right!!!

Reviews.Title: “Seventh Visit to the Seven Hills”
Reviews.Author: BillaEdwards
Reviews.Content: I am now booking my next trip to Istanbul and taking 12 friends with me. This will be the 5th year of staying at the SevenHhills Hotel with a group for 4 - 5 days. Wonderful location. The staff excell in making your stay comfortable and dealing with any requests ie local dentist, losing credit cards etc. We wll love Seven Hills. Can't wait to see you again Bulent.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Seven Hills”
Reviews.Author: DCRealtor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and a friend with whom we were traveling stayed at this little gem for three nights the middle of June. It is not luxurious but what made it so special was its location - right between the Hagia Sophia on one side and the Blue Mosque on the other. We had a delicious breakfast every morning on the roof terrace restaurant and gazed at these fascinating ancient buildings on either side of us. The other thing that was so wonderful was the owners, a young Turkish couple who went out of their way to be helpful and make us comfortable. They even upgraded us to a suite. The rooms were simple, no air conditioning and therefore a bit noisy, especially early in the evening, but the location and the staff more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fromdenile
Reviews.Content: We were originally booked at the Uyun Hotel next door for 6 nights in early October. The room we were given there was underground and very dreary. When they failed to change our room the following day as promised, I walked next door to the Seven Hills and for the same price was given a fantastic room on the 3rd floor with a nice outdoor balcony. The staff could not have been friendlier and went above and beyond to provide us with an excellent experience. Thank you Hotel Seven Hills! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the people!”
Reviews.Author: Jaanoo
Reviews.Content: Seven Hills Hotel, Istanbul, Turkey. Date: November 6, 2006 Reviewer: Visitor from Canada Initially got in touch with the property to get additional information. The General Manager, Bulent Sayan, immediately responded and gave me all the necessary details - never before have I received such service! I travel a lot and have stayed in hotels and serviced apartments; but I have never seen a team of staff as the one at Seven Hills Hotel. They are incredible....it was home away from home for me. The General Manager saw to all our needs, catered our tours according to our wishes (and not impose tours on us); the owner is such a friendly, down-to-earth person. The food is exquisite! The service fantastic. Whenever my aunt didn't want to go anywhere, I would take that as an excuse for myself and go to the restaurant, which has an unbelievable view from the roof top, and spend my afternoon on the internet! As soon as I would get there, one of the friendly staff would bring me apple tea with such grace! I would go there mainly to chat with everyone - and I was always successful!! I highly recommend this hotel - which has wonderful view from their rooms - to whoever is visiting Istanbul. Don't be disappointed and make sure you book well in advance. If, for whatever reason you miss out on getting a room - don't miss out on going to their restaurant.......just amazing - scrumptous food!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: holomakani
Reviews.Content: I originally read about this hotel in Food & Wine Mag. I contacted the Hotel via the Internet. The General Manager, Bulent, was a joy to work with. He arranged transportation from the ship and to the airport. He can also arrange tours. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are clean and the views from the roof top dining are wonderful. The location is excellent. We were able to walk to most places. Great cafe's near by and the restaurant at the hotel was also good.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh my friends....”
Reviews.Author: The_Heat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very nice visit to Istanbul and stay at the Seven Hills Hotel. As most have written, the staff is awesome, the location couldn't be better, and the overall experience was top. Look no further for a hotel in Istanbul, Seven Hills was great. Close to everything, we walked from the hotel everyday to the places we wanted to visit, the mosques, bazaars, cistern, palace, and more places to eat than we could try. Of course, Istanbul is huge, and we limited our visit to the area around the hotel, but there are plenty of tour operators to arrange more. Istanbul, a must see! and Seven Hills, a must stay!

Reviews.Title: “Five Times In Turkey”
Reviews.Author: ryanboyd
Reviews.Content: Five years ago I had the good fortune to take my first trip to Istanbul. I was staying in a typical large American hotel, which was OK, but did not have any 'personal' connection. I had the good fortune to meet a restaurant manager, who, upon listening to my mild complaint about where I was staying, proceeded to take me personally to the Seven Hills Hotel, where I ended up staying for the remainder of my trip. The staff treats you like family, one the you really like that is. They are attentive and personal, but still maintain that professional touch. The manager, Bullent, is beyond exceptional at accommodating and anticipating your every need. I just returned from my 5th visit to this charming hotel and the friends that I made there. I have recommended the Seven Hills to many of my clients, all of whom have been equally satisfied. I own a top end hair salon in West Hollywood, CA., where customer service is of paramount importance. As a result, I thoroughly appreciate great customer service, and a business that demands high standard. If you are looking for an intimate hotel, that will take care of you in a very personal manner, look not further as this is it. The repeat visitor.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal!”
Reviews.Author: morgini
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Seven Hills for 6 days in early October, 2006. We were supposed to go to Bodrum for 3 of those days but canceled when we realized how much there was to see in Istanbul. Bulent, the manager, was very cooperative in finding us space for the three extra days, but there was some mis-communication and our last day, which was a separate reservation, was given away. With the language barrier it is always important to verify things and I neglected to do that. The hotel is in the perfect location as everyone else has mentioned. We only used a taxi twice in 6 days and walked the rest of the time. Bulent and his team were very good at arranging restaurants that provided free transportation. Although I am not into hokey tourist productions, the Orient Cafe that Bulent hooked us up with was great. We stayed in one of the suites-the Presidential and it was very spacious and relatively inexpensive (220E per night). My friend stayed in the Marmara Suite (402) and said it was very noisy. The rooftop restaurant was great for cocktails and winding down at the end of the day. The staff was some of the most friendly I have encountered on my travels. Breakfast is on the terrace, and from a US or European standpoint is not what we are used to. But, they are willing to make some eggs, and it makes for an OK start to the day. I would definitely stay here again. In all of Sultan Ahmet, it seems like the best deal (stayed one night at the 4 Seasons and the bill was $800US by the time I checked out!!)

Reviews.Title: “perfect location in Istanbul, excellent amenities”
Reviews.Author: TheMeadowsTravel
Reviews.Content: Generally, the two most important factors dictating hotel choice in Istanbul are proximity to sights and view. The Seven Hills Hotel (SHH) delivers BIG on both accounts. It has the highest rooftop terrace restaurant on the Bosphorous side of the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and a truly unobstructed, proximal view to both behemoths. The view from SSH's rooftop terrace of these two architectural wonders is truly breathtaking and its possible to sit for hours wiling away the time, being mesmerized by the sights of this man-made beauty as well as the natural beauty of the Bosphorous - of which SHH also has the best view in the vicinity. The Gelata Tower, across the Golden Horn and approximately two miles from the SHH, is also visible from the terrace. Service on the terrace and in the restaurant just below the terrace (which offers seasonal outdoor seating with views to the Bosphorous) is excellent - the waiters are friendly, helpful and seem sincerely intent on ensuring a positive experience for their guests. The restaurant excells in its offerings of traditional Turkish appetizers, fresh fish and Turkish wines. While not cheap, the restaurnt (like the hotel in general) offers good value. For warm-blooded guests, the waiters graciously offer shawls to ward off the evening's chills while enjoying the sights and the restaurant's offerings. PROXIMITY: Per above, SHH is ideally situated in Istanbul's old city and numerous major sights are within an easy walk. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and Topkapi palace are no more than 250 meters from the hotel. The Grand Bazaar is no more than a kilometer away; the Roman Cistern (the famous and architecturally exquisite underground water reservoir) and the Hippodrome are approximately 300 meters away and the famous Cegalogu Turkish/Roman bath approximately 600 meters distant. For jaunts to the Spice Market or across the Golden Horn, the hyper-modern streetcar stops 250 meters from the hotel. INTERNET: One of the greatest pluses is the superb wireless internet network in the hotel; to compensate for the thick concrete and stone walls, each floor has a separate high-speed router/network. Additionally, the hotel generously makes a computer available in the rooftop terrace area (with a Turkish-language keyboard, ensuring message recipients have to carefully read your cryptic transmissions from Istanbul!) to hotel guests traveling without laptops. The hotel is not a luxury or boutique accommodation, but delivers all advertised services and many other amenities. Built in an old Ottoman residence, it has many interesting interior architectural touches including elaborate ceiling and crown mouldings. The furniture and rugs are all Ottoman style antiques. The front desk staff impressed and surprised me with the detail, friendliness and sincerity of their email correspondence prior to my arrival. The breakfast buffet was more than ample - offering a variety of meats, cheeses, fruits, breads, vegetables and cereals. Rooms are equipped with reasonably-priced minibars. A common expression in Turkey, "No problem" really could be the official slogan of SHH. HAWKERS: The hotel sits in the middle of what must be the world's largest concentration of highly talented hawkers. Your best defense is to completely ignore these predators - who will pose as tourist information assistants in the major sights. After offering a few tidbits of information, incredibly, they will invite you to their carpet, ceramics or trinket stores where the hard sell begins. The hawkers are linguistically gifted and will impress even the most hardened foreigner with their ability to play on a tourist's guilt when ignored. I would caution travelers only to carefully watch extras charged to your hotel account - on checkout we were surprised to find the actual charge for city tours to have doubled over the quoted price, a laundry charge to have come out being three times the estimate and a restaurant dinner charge from a previous room occupant on our bill. We chose not to contest the tours and laundry as they could well have been a misunderstanding, but did refuse to pay the previous guest's dinner bill. We will definitely be staying at the Seven Hills for our next trip to Istanbul; from our perspective, there's no reason to look further.
