Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel that treated us like family”
Reviews.Author: ejgm
Reviews.Content: After deciding that Turkey was an ideal place to honeymoon, we were referred to the Seven Hills Hotel by our uncle, who stayed there for 9 days and wanted to stay longer! Highlights: The location could not be better--about a 2 minute walk to the Blue Mosque in Sultanahmet. The rooms were gorgeous--easily equivalent to a 4-5 star hotel (they're small enough that they can't be rated with stars). In my opinion, the rooftop restaurant has the best view in Sultanahmet--you can clearly see the Blue Mosque, the Haghia Sofia, and a gorgeous view of the waterways of Istanbul. It was sunny and warm during our visit, which always helps :) But mostly, it was the staff that made our time there special. Our uncle insisted that we go there because he felt so much like he was treated like one of the family. We were treated very cordially every time we saw a staff member. BlÃ¼ent, the manager, and Sema, the day shift leader, were very friendly and helpful--we cannot say enough good things about them. At one point, a staff member helped us carry our bags across town, and when we needed a ride to the hotel, we were transported in a luxurious van--much better than the treatment you get in the USA! This hotel also owned another property a few blocks away that had just opened. They said we were the new hotel's 6th customer! We stayed there for an evening in a huge room with a king sized bed, a jacuzzi tub, marble countertop in the bath, and the most amazing elevator I'd seen in years. Since we were newer customers and did some business with their travel agency partner (read below), we got a good deal--about half the hotel's "rack rate" for that stay. The hotel also partnered with a travel agency nearby, Kommegene Travel, who booked tour packages for 9 out of our 16 days in Turkey. Overall, they did a great job, choosing great options that matched the experiences we sought and were very responsive to our needs. Actually, they knew we were on honeymoon, so they had wine waiting for us on two different occasions. It was very sweet. Concerns Of course, no trip goes perfectly. All over Turkey, we had trouble figuring out the remote controls for the A/C units, which seem more advanced than those in the USA. In the room in the new hotel, there was a slow leak in the A/C unit that dripped into the room. They explained that it was so new that it was the first time the A/C had been used after install, so we were happy to accept their promise to have it looked at the following day. Our other caution didn't involve the hotels at all, but the tours we booked and went on. Part of it was that Turkey was completely new to us and we weren't sure what to expect, but we found ourselves wishing that we were better informed about some parts of our tours. For example, when they say "free meal", that means free food, but you pay for drinks, even water. In a warm/hot climate like Turkey, you have to drink all of the time, so we were constantly buying 5L jugs of water from local markets for 1.5 YTL rather than paying 2-3 YTL per 1/2 liter bottle during a meal. Also, they say the night buses stop for periodic bathroom breaks, but sometimes those breaks didn't happen, or happened once in the course of a 9 hour trip! Don't be afraid to ask the travel agent specifics about your tour(s), and to get their phone numbers when you have questions or problems. Overall, this hotel far exceeded our expectations, even after we left. When they heard that I had left an important item in a remote part of Turkey, they arranged have the item transported to the hotel and sent it to me in the USA. Now that's service! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering a visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: jdevgan
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Seven Hills was lovely, thanks in large part to its manager (Bulent). I highly recommend this hotel to anyone considering staying in Istanbul. As other reviewers have stated, the location of the hotel is ideal, since you are in the very heart of Sultanahmet. The views from the hotel are phenomenal. But truly, it was the service provided by Bulent and the other hotel staff that made our experience memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with lovely people”
Reviews.Author: kawti
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seven Hills was fantastic. My flatmate and I stayed there for several days and we must say that the view from their terrace was marvelous. It's literally a stone's throw away from the Blue Mosque and the Sophia. And their terrace is higher than the Four Seasons' next door! More importantly, the staff was wonderful, friendly, and very helpful. Though I must say it helped that we were a friend of a friend of someone who worked at the hotel -- however, I get the feeling that they would have treated everyone else with the same hospitality. I highly recommend it - great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Seven Hills is the best!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Seven Hills is an excellent hotel. The location couldn't be better---right in the middle of Sultanahmet and in walking distance to major attractions. The staff is very friendly and personable and the manager, Bulent, is the best -- most cordial, helpful and accommodating. We also used a travel agency associated with the Seven Hills Hotel, Turkland Travel, to book several tours that we were very happy with. Both the travel agency and the hotel have always done exactly what they said they would do and on time -- and that means a lot to us! The food is very good, not to mention the magnificent view of this incredible city and the Bosphorous from the terrace/restaurant. The included breakfast is one of the best that we have found in all of our travels in Europe and Asia. The location is great for all shoppng and sight-seeing. The rooms are lovely and comfortable and reasonably priced. We will soon be staying at the Seven Hills for our fourth time and basically there is no reason for us to stay anywhere else in Istanbul! Hope that you enjoy your stay as much as we do! Teri and George Tullos, Atyrau, Kazakhstan

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Seven Hills”
Reviews.Author: stephr007
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a fantastic turkish adventure and couldnt wait to share my thoughts. We learned about Seven Hills via Trip Advisor and are grateful to the other reviewers. The Seven Hills Hotel was fantastic. You cannot beat the location and the roof deck. Staff - over the top. Rooms - adorable, clean, classic. Food- Unreal, fresh, top notch. Bulent, the manager was so accomodating and friendly. His staff is perfectly trained and anticpated our needs - we didn't need to ask! The fresh breakfast was delicious and a great way to start a fun day in Istanbul. Make sure to ask for an omelette - the breakfast manager makes the best. Take Bulent's advice - he really knows his stuff and his suggestions were really honest and helpful. I'm excited to get back to Istanbul and be welcomed at Seven Hills. Just an overall great expereince. One caveat - you should stay away from the rooms on the top (4th) floor. They can be a bit noisy due to their proximity to the popular, stunnning roof deck. A last note- my sister stayed across the street at the Four Seasons. While you can't go wrong with a four seasons, she spent more time at our hotel dining and relaxing on the roof deck which by far exceeded the lounge areas at her hotel! Kudos Bulent!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: hal276
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Seven Hills for 3 nights in the middle of June. We liked it very much, would recommend it to others. As others state, the location is superb and the rooftop restaurant view (wow !) is probably the best of any hotel in the city. We found Bulent to be an excellent manger and the other staff members to be very helpful. The manager of the breakfast buffet got up early to make us omelets to go with the buffet as we had an early morning flight and had to leave prior to the normal opening for breakfast. We were upgraded to the Blue Mosque room on the 4th floor. While you could hear chairs move above you in the restaurant, it did not wake us up in the morning nor prevent us from sleeping (as stated in another review). The view from the room has got to be the best in Istanbul with the Blue Mosque so close. We had breakfast and early evening drinks on the rooftop restaurant. Drinks are not cheap, but you can have one drink and admire the views for as long as you want. We did not eat in the hotel restaurant but ate at a great place 20 yards from the hotel on the same side of the street-( walk out of hotel and make a right; only restaurant there). Recommended by the hotel, it was superb and reasonably priced. No need to take hotel's car service from airport--take taxi both ways as it is half the price. Hotel gives 10% off if payment is in cash---that includes anything you bill to your room (e.g. drinks, tours,) during the stay---nice discount-- We took the two half-day tours in one day. While Bulent told us the various bus tour options, he never pushed the tours on us. It was our decision based on having only two days in the city. The afternoon tour to Topaki Palace, et. al. was definitely not worth the money (do it on your own)---Morning tour to Mosques and Bazaar was better, but still expensive (30 euros) ---last hour was "talk" from carpet experts and bazaar and you could do that on your own--they do give a free lunch (very good) if you take both 1/2 day yours same day----I read in travel guide (Frommer) that hotel is associated with next door carpet store, and that they will solicit you as you enter and leave hotel---We never encountered that , we were never even approached to come in to the carpet store-- For the location, view, service, price, Seven Hills is a great place to stay for a few days in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 2 hotels at Istanbul in May 2006. First at the Conrad Hotel in Besiktas (north Istanbul on the European side) then at the Seven Hills in Sultanahmet. The Conrad is a huge hotel and a little bit souless - you could have been anywhere on the planet and you would not have known it. However, it did everything that could have been asked of it and it did it in style. Nevertheless, my heart was given to the Seven Hills hotel. Quite possibly the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in abroad. It has character in buckets, the rooms (especially the suites) are large and comfortable, the staff were friendly and the manager (Bulent) was the perfect host. The views from the rooftop restaurant were fantastic and the food was as good as any that we had in restaurants elsewhere in Istanbul. The Seven Hills is a perfect base from which to tour the old part of Istanbul. Everything was well within walking distance or easily reached by tram/taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Seven Hills Istanbul on my vacation last May. I have to say I really enjoyed the two weeks I spent there. The hotel staff tried their best to make me as comfortable and happy as possible. The location of hotel, clean rooms, and friendly staff are the highlights of this hotel. The reservation and service staff are excellent, for example the night I arrived to Istanbul I had about three hours delay. I never thought that the hotel pick up service still waiting for me at 1:30 AM in the morning. But hotel management made sure that I will be picked up and bring to the hotel. That was very important to any woman who is traveling alone to a new country. Not to forget to mention that every morning the hotel guests started with a very fresh continental breakfast in a very relaxing atmospher on the roof of the hotel. I have congratulate the hotel management on their service and hard work to keep their hotel guests happy. I will never forget my trip to Istanbul and staying in Hotel seven Hills. Azar from Los Angeles, California USA

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mpm1271
Reviews.Content: There are many reasons to rate the Seven Hills as "excellent". The location couldn't be better---right in the middle of Sultanahmet and in walking distance to major sites. The staff is exceedingly friendly and personable. You'll come away with a whole new set of friends! The food is exceptional in taste and beauty, not to mention the magnificent view of this incredible city from the terrace/restaurant. And, of course, the rooms are lovely and VERY comfortable and reasonably priced. Basically, you have every reason to stay at the Seven Hills(and no valid reason to stay elsewhere!). Enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a six night stay at the Seven Hills Hotel in Istanbul. The view from the rooftop restaurant is enough reason to book a room here. Magnificent views of the Hagia Sophia, the Blue Mosque and the Bosphorus took our breath away. Our room was spacious and very clean. The hard working staff went out of its way to meet our every need and showed a personal interest in our comfort. From this location, you are within walking distance of most of the Istanbul "must see" sights. We arrived with a general idea of what we wanted to do. The general manager got us organized and helped get us tours. I am sure he gets a cut from the tour system but we were satisfied. The food at the restaurant was as good as any we had in Istanbul. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. We hope to return there some day.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in 4 hotels”
Reviews.Author: alan_mtl
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul in Sept 05 and due to changes in our travel plans actually stayed in 4 hotels in the area. Seven Hills was our favourite - great room (suite), fantastic views, and helpful service. All of the hotels around have rooftop restaurants (some just bfast) and the seven hills looks down on them all. Superb views of Sea of Marmara, Aya Sophia & Blue Mosque, even from the balcony of our room. We also stayed at the 4 Seasons which is definitely 5 star & expensive, but it's much lower & the views do not compare. The day we arrived at the 7 Hills they were overbooked, but had arranged for us to stay next door at the Yuan which was OK for one night, but lacked character. The last night we were in the Yesil Ev which is authentic old style but small rooms & has a lovely shaded garden restaurant with a fountain. There's a street a couple of blocks down the hill with decent restaurants. You will be pressured to take a guide, we did to visit Topkapi, but not really necessary

Reviews.Title: “An ok place...”
Reviews.Author: omar1671
Reviews.Content: Stayed here not too long ago. Positives: -The best view of the old city from the roof-top restaurant; -Door man and restaurant staff are very friendly -One of the few places that has an elevator Negatives: -Recommend booking a room on the higher floors (hear street noises and voices from the lobby from the 1st flr unit) -Manager is a moody sort (see other comments which pretty much rang true) Conclusion: -Cutting costs often times is not worth it and this stay proves that point. In hindsight, we should should have booked the Four Seasons across the street and then simply visited the restaurant at Seven Hills for the view. If you want a short stay and will rarely be in your hotel room then perhaps the Seven Hills might be a good choice.
